Title: National Seminars Essential Skills of Dynamic Public Speaking
Description:
This workshop is chock-full of techniques that will make any business presentation a whole lot easier on your nerves. You’ll learn powerful skills and solid strategies to survive presentations without much preparation time … respond smoothly when asked to make a few impromptu remarks … and never skip a beat when your audience starts drilling you with tough questions.


	Connect with your audience
	Get your point across clearly
	Remain calm, cool, and collected
	Breeze through the toughest question-and-answer periods

Title: National Seminars Organization Skills for the Overwhelmed
Description:
This training is focused on delivering the must-have skills you need to master your time and maximize your effectiveness. Learn you how to dissect your workday to see which activities are good time investments and which habits you’ve picked up are flat-out time-wasters.


	How to break the urge to keep everything
	A step-by-step method for turning piles into files
	Desk-clearing techniques to make you look neat in just minutes
	How to gain control of your desk, your storage systems, and even your walls
	Effective alternatives to the “sticky note method” of remembering important things
	How to make the most out of your workspace — even if it’s tiny!
	What to do with all those unorganized e-mails you’ve been storing for months

Title: Western Union AMLCP Cash Office refresher 2012 QTR1
Description:
This course is designed for Cash Office Associates. 
The purpose of this course is to ensure compliance with the US Patriot Act which includes any money transfers and money order sales and also to maintain a common training program amongst the Divisions. Any violations of this program could subject our company and associates to severe criminal and civil penalties and could seriously damage the good name of our stores and company.

Title: Western Union AMLCP Refresher Training Knowledge Check Cash Office 2012  QTR1
Description: Western Union AMLCP Refresher Training Knowledge Check Cash Office 2012

Title: Nový MIS
Description:
Přechod na nový MIS !!!!!

 

Během tohoto školení se dozvíte, jak prostřednictvím webového nástroje získat rychle informace o desítkách firemních ukazatelů, dělat analýzy přes nejrůznější pohledy (sortiment, prodejny, dodavatelé), zjišťovat příčiny extrémních stavů, tvořit dynamické dokumenty, ve kterých se automaticky mění hodnoty podle čerstvého stavu v systémech a mnoho dalšího.

Před termínem daného školení, obdržíte do svých e-mailů podpůrný materiál/manuál. Doporučujeme všem účastníkům, aby se s tímto manuálem seznámili od str.1 do str.8 ještě před účasti na školení.

Title: AH to go - Coördinators in control: speedy service with a smile (NL)
Description:
Hoe jij omgaat met de klant en met collega's bepaalt jouw succes!

Beschikbaar zijn voor de klant en beschikbaar zijn voor je collega's. Het klink zo logisch, de praktijk blijkt echter lastiger. In deze workshop leer je wat het belang is van goed communiceren met je collega's en hoe de manier waarop je dat doet bepalend is voor het succes van Albert Heijn to go. Als de communicatie onderling goed verloopt, blijft er vanzelf tijd over om in contact te zijn met de klant. Je weet wel, die mensen die er voor zorgen dat jij deze uitdagende baan mag invullen. Klantcontact, een glimlach op elk moment van de dag. Dat is toch logisch.

Voorkennis: Opleiding verkoper en coördinator
Taal: Nederlands
Leverancier: Moovs
Locatie: Zie agenda
Deelnemers: Minimaal 8 en maximaal 12

This course requires approximately 5 minutes to complete.Language: English

Title: MASTERCLASS COMMERCIEEL MEDEWERKER
Description:
Na selectie en het volgen van een stage nemen alle Commercieel Medewerkers deel aan deze training.
De Masterclass bestaat uit 4 blokken en een examen.
1. Kick off en krijtschrijven
2. Themaverkoop en kinderactiviteit
3. Visual merchandising en Demonstreren en proeven
4. Marktverkoop
Tijdens de bijeenkomsten wordt er naast het verstrekken van informatie in de praktijk geoefend.
Klantcontact in relatie tot Verkoop staat steeds centraal. Tussen de blokken worden er opdrachten in de eigen winkel uitgevoerd. De trainingen worden begeleid door een externe trainer. De startbijeenkomst wordt verzorgd door de OM. Het examen wordt uitgevoerd in de eigen winkel.

Title: MIS pro pokročilé (MIS for Advanced)
Description:
Toto školení je určeno pro pokročilé uživatele systému MIS.



Základní témata:

- zopakování základních principů práce se systémem MIS

- vztahy mezi dalšími informačními zdroji: Gold reporty, Ahold Inforportál, MIS

- pokročilé ukazatele Measures advanced - pro účely srovnání meziročních výsledků, promočních analýz atd.

- diskuze, vaše dotazy z praxe



Rozsah školení:

3 hodiny

Místo konání:

Praha



Školitel:

školení je realizováno prostřednictvím interního lektora





Klíčová slova:

prodeje, promoce, report

Title: Learning tool Balanced Scorecard (Norton & Kaplan) (EN)
Description:
Translating strategic problems into concrete actions and subsequently monitoring the execution.

How can you measure whether your department is realising its objectives? How can you translate a strategy into measurable objectives? Which areas can you measure? You can read this tool in order to answer these questions. The tool explains what the Balanced Score Card is, how this is structured and how you can use it.

The method
The Balanced Score Card assumes four areas: finance, learning and development, customers and internal processes. All these areas have their own subareas, which can be developed and maintained per subarea. The subareas are:
- Objectives
- Standards or performance indicators (KPI’s)
- Targets or performance standards
- Initiatives

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through this tool.

Title: Learning tool Bad news conversation (EN)
Learning tool Circle of influence and involvement (EN)
Description:
Determine the right and most logical thing to do from your specific role.

How do you make sure you devote energy to all the aspects which you can influence? How can you make sure you don’t become negative by matters you can’t influence? This tool can help you to realise both your business and personal objectives.

The method
The circle of influence and involvement can show you how you can positively influence your energy in your working life. An important indicator is: does it make me more energetic? We will also address which roles a proactive and reactive attitude play in this regard and what the affect of both attitudes are.

Required time
It will take approximately 15 minutes to read through this tool.

Title: Learning Tool Clever conversation techniques (EN)
Description:
Applying a clever conversation technique when a conversation is heading in the wrong direction.

Do you know that feeling of being miles away from the intended objective during a conversation? Would you like to learn how to steer a conversation in a different direction? Do you have a need for clever conversation techniques which you could use during a conversation? Then read through this tool about clever conversation techniques. The tool will also provide you with information regarding which techniques you can apply to steer a conversation in a different direction.

The method
The tool looks at various different techniques which can be applied during a conversation:

• The flexible technique
• The funnel technique
• The parking technique
• The ignoring technique
• The reducing technique
• The enlarging technique
• The judo technique

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through the tool.

Description:

Title: Learning tool Ahold Solving puzzles as part of a team (EN)
Description:
An exercise to demonstrate the cooperation process and identify improvement areas.

Are you on the look out for an exercise with which you can acquire an insight into how a team is working together? Would you like the exercise to help you find out which behaviour is obstructing effective cooperation within the team? Then use the solving puzzles as part of a team exercise. This exercise is an excellent aid for observing which behaviour in a team results in cooperation levels being stimulated or reduced. The tool includes the description of the exercise and information regarding what you need to carry it out.

The method
Solving puzzles as part of a team is an exercise which should be carried out to bring the behaviour which is linked to cooperation within a team to the surface. The exercise is ultimately suitable for teams which also work together in their daily practices.

Required time
Completing the solving puzzles as part of a team exercise will take approximately 55 minutes, including the preparation phase.

Title: Learning Tool Conflict management (EN)
Description:
Using the most effective conflict management style for a specific situation.

Would you like to know what your preferred style is where dealing with conflicts is concerned? Would you like to learn to recognise the various different conflict management styles? Or would you like to be able to use the most effective conflict management style during a conflict? Then read this tool. It provides a description of the various different conflict management styles, as well as how and when these are best applied. The tool also includes a test which you can use to find out what your own preferred style is where dealing with conflicts is concerned.

The method
The way in which someone deals with a conflict is either focussed on looking after a relationship or focussed on the result. You will end up with five conflict management styles when you position these two extremes in an axial system:

- Forcing
- Integrating
- Avoiding
- Conceding
- Looking for a compromise

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through this tool. Completing the test will also take around 10 minutes.

Title: Learning tool Debating (EN)
Description:
Arguing and presenting a proposition as effectively as possible.

Would you like to find a structured way of collecting visions in your team? Would you like to have a discussion with your team, department or project group? Have various different points of view been underexposed in a team, project or daily work practices? Then it would certainly be useful to enter into discussions from different perspectives.

Would you like the above questions answered? This tool will provide you with information and guidelines which can be used to enter into a discussion about various different propositions together with a team or project group. We also refer to this as debating. The tool also includes a handy assignment which can be carried out in your ‘parliamentary’ team.

The method
A good debate satisfies a number of predetermined game rules. You, as the debater, also need to be well prepared where you proposition and arguments are concerned. Agreements are entered into about the type of debate and the speaking time. The method is focussed on convincing a third party, rather than an opponent, of your point of view and vision.

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through this tool. Planning a session will depend on the number of propositions you want to debate about.

Title: OUT OF SERVICE Deli Associate Training (Server Version)
Description:
To ensure consistency in specified Learning Objectives, Computer Based Training (CBT), a form of e-learning, will be utilized in combination with other training formats.  CBT will provide a generalized overview of the many areas in our stores. Topics covered in Deli are as follows:
1. Introduction
2. Remarkable Customer Service
3. Deli Service Case
4. Food Safety and Associate Safety
5. Sales Floor
6. Rotation and productivity
7. Shrink

Title: Learning tool McGregor’s X-Y theory (EN)
Description:
How the managers’ approach influences the employees’ motivation.

Do you dare to let go every now and then, or do you prefer keeping everything completely under control? 
Would you like to know how this influences your employees’ motivation? Then read through this learning tool about McGregor’s X-Y theory. The tool describes two behavioural models which show conflicting views regarding how people are structured. A test which will help you discover which style you prefer is also included.

The method
McGregor differentiates between the X theory and Y theory. Theory X assumes that employees are naturally lazy and that supervision and power resources are needed to ensure people keep working. Theory Y almost assumes the opposite, in that people can find work as enjoyable and motivating as a game.

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through this tool. Completing the test will also take around 10 minutes.

Title: SF_test_E-learning
Description:
Co je trestní odpovědnost právnických osob a jaké dopady má na naši každodenní práci?
Školení seznamuje účastníky s oblastí, pravidly a případnými důsledky chování a jednání zaměstnanců, které není v souladu se Zákonem o trestní odpovědnosti. Je důležité vědět, čemu se vyhnout a jak se chovat při externích jednáních za společnost, ale i při dodržování interních procesů.

Title: Learning tool Observing (EN)
Description:
A method for describing employees’ or customers’ behaviour.

Would you like to acquire an insight into your employees’ behaviour? Would you like to look at your customers’ behaviour? Or are you planning a coaching, progress or performance appraisal with your employee and you would like to start the meeting well prepared? Or do you want to understand why certain actions don’t always achieve the desired results?

Would you like answers to these questions? Then read through the observing tool. The theory will tell you more about what observing really is and you will also be able to apply it in practice yourself with the instructions provided.

The method
You obviously need decent information in order to find answers to these questions. Your observations are of the utmost importance for this. Observations provide a description of an action by an employee or customer who you are observing in his/her environment. Observing should be done as objectively as possible and with a specific aim in mind. You will be using the ORCE rules for this purpose:

- Observing
- Registering
- Categorising
- Evaluating

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read the methodology. You will need at least 15 minutes for carrying out an observation.

Title: Learning tool Hand Method (EN)
Description:
An exercise to safely get to know each other better.

Would you like to do an introductory round at the start of a meeting? Are you looking for a safe way for people to get to know each other? Or would you like to challenge people to say a little more about themselves? Then read this tool about the hand method. It’s an exercise you can use in groups with up to 15 participants.

The method
The hand method is an exercise whereby participants introduce themselves to the rest of the group by saying a little about themselves using each finger from one hand.

Required time
Carrying out the hand method will take approximately 20 minutes, including the preparation phase.

Title: Learning tool Presenting (EN)
Description:
Giving a presentation in an informative and influential manner.

Would you like to know how to give a clear and effective presentation? How can you prepare yourself for a presentation? What are all the different things you need to think about? How do I find the right posture during my presentation? Would you like answers to these questions? Then read through the presenting tool, which describes what presenting is and how to do it well.

The method
We differentiate between informative presenting and influential presenting. Effective preparation is of crucial importance and this preparation will take around four to five times as long as the presentation itself. You can work on the preparation with questions like: why? what? when? where? and how? The presentation’s structure is in accordance with the head-body-tail method.

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through this tool. Preparing for a 10 minute presentation will take between 45 minutes and an hour.

Title: Learning tool Correction conversation (EN)
Description:
A formal conversation whereby you correct employees’ undesirable behaviour, unsatisfactorily completed tasks or the violation of rules.

What do you do if employees are constantly violating rules? How do you deal with employees who display undesirable behaviour? What do you need to pay attention to when you speak to employees about their behaviour? And how should you do this? This tool will be very helpful if you want to know how and when you should conduct a formal correction conversation.

The method
There are various different ways of correcting employees. Perhaps by immediately talking to them when you notice they have violated a rule or displayed undesirable behaviour. We refer to this as the 1 minute reprimand. Another form is the formal correction conversation whereby you correct an employee and enter into agreements regarding future behaviour.
You don’t conduct this formal conversation until you have asked yourself whether this is the correct course of action. So you should always check whether correcting the employee is justified before the conversation and whether you are dealing with this consistently.

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through this tool.

Title: Learning tool SMART Principle (EN)
Description:
Formulating objectives in such a way that they lead to agreements which you can hold each other to.

Are your employees not fulfilling their agreements? Are you constantly faced with comments like ‘I didn’t know that’s what we agreed?’ or ‘Do you want that already?’ Do you want to make sure your entire team commits to the agreements? Then ask the SMART questions when setting your objectives. Are your objectives SMART? And do you think: what was it again?
Use this tool to check whether your objectives are formulated in line with the SMART principle.

The method
You answer a number of questions in order to make your objectives workable. Objectives then become agreements which you can hold each other to. SMART stands for:

- Specific, the objective is clear and concrete
- Measurable, the objective is standardised
- Acceptable, the objective has been positively formulated and therefore has support
- Realistic, the objective is feasible
- Time bound, a SMART objective has an end date

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through this tool.

Title: Learning tool Coaching (EN)
Description:
A conversation whereby you are helping a person being coached to become successful.

Have you been asked to coach someone? Do you know exactly what you should be doing? Or would you like to find out a little more about coaching? Perhaps you are an employee who needs some coaching? Then read through this coaching tool. It will explain all the things coaching sessions need to satisfy, as well as clear details of all the aspects you need to pay attention to as a coach. You can also structure the coaching session correctly by using the head-body-tail method.

The method
You are helping the other person to think of solutions himself during a coaching session. This will enable the person being coached to tackle any future problems himself. The five area analysis is an excellent aid which can be used for coaching. This analysis helps with determining negative behaviour. This concerns the following five areas:

- Skills
- Task conception
- Preparedness
- Assistance
- (Work) situation

Required time
It will take approximately 15 minutes to read through this tool.

Title: Learning tool World Café (EN)
Description:
An exercise to bring about effective dialogue and collect plenty of output.

Have you ever been on the look out for a fun exercise for entering into dialogue with a large group of people? Would you like to collect output about a theme with lots of participants arranged into subgroups? Then try the World Café exercise. The tool describes how the exercise works and what you will need. It discusses a number of possible variants too.

The method
The World Café is a thematic exercise for collecting ideas about specific themes. The method ensures all interesting information from various different discussions is documented, allowing you to get working on the output at a later stage.

Required time
Completing the World Café exercise will take around 40 minutes, including the preparation phase. The exercise can also be expanded with several rounds, which will result in an additional 20 minutes per round.

Title: Learning tool Meetings (EN)
Description:
Effective meetings in order to share information and ideas or improve cooperation levels.

Are you dissatisfied about the way in which meetings are conducted? Would you like to know how to make meetings effective? Or would you like to know how a meeting can contribute to better cooperation between people? Then read this tool about meetings. The tool provides information regarding the best way to structure a meeting, which aspects you need to consider during a meeting and which roles you can recognise.

The method
There are three important aspects for conducting effective meetings:
- Content
- Procedure
- Atmosphere

Required time
It will take approximately 15 minutes to read through this tool.

Title: Learning tool Development appraisal (EN)
Description:
An appraisal within which you guide employees towards the setting up of their personal development plan.

Getting to grips with your personal development – that certainly sounds logical, but is it really that easy? Do you know all the things which need to be discussed during a development appraisal? So how do you do that, discussing someone’s development? This tool will enable you to effectively prepare for a development appraisal.

The method
The development appraisal is a conversation which needs to be carried out in accordance with the head-body-tail method. This conversation is all about an employee’s personal development. It’s a two way conversation, with the manager taking on a coaching role. This tool goes through a number of steps which you, as the manager, can effectively prepare for. We would also recommend reading through a number of the other tools before conducting a development appraisal, like coaching, the SMART principle and the STAR method.

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through this tool.

Title: Learning tool Intervention levels (EN)
Description:
Effectively switching between the various different communication levels.

Do you ever get the feeling that there’s something else going on when you’re in conversation with colleagues or employees? That gut feeling that you can’t quite put your finger on. After all, your stomach has a very important signal function. This tool will tell you more about recognising these signals and even more importantly, how to deal with them.

The method
The intervention levels tool differentiates between four different levels:

- Content
- Procedure
- Interaction
- Feelings and emotions

You will need to be able to switch between the various different levels if you want to communicate efficiently.

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through the tool.

Title: Learning tool Progress meeting (EN)
Description:
Discussing your employee’s progress where his development and results are concerned.

So what exactly should you be discussing during a progress meeting? How do you prepare an interim assessment of an employee’s development? How can you use a meeting to focus on the results? Does the progress meeting lead to the desired result? This tool will explain the purpose of a progress meeting and how you can effectively conduct one. The tool also includes a checklist for preparing for this meeting well. The eventual objective is that you can see progress in an employee’s performance levels together. We have also included an exercise, which can be used when conducting a progress meeting.

The method
Conversations are structured in accordance with the head-body-tail method. The same thing applies to the progress meeting. Plus you’ll also be making use of the STAR method, as the progress of someone’s performance is being discussed. The agreements you enter into are formulated in line with the SMART method.

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through this tool. Preparing for the progress meeting will take around 15 minutes per employee.

Title: Violence in the Workplace
Description:
Learn how to keep your supply chain associates safe in an emergency.
During the session, associates will review company expectations of how to treat each another regardless of differences, discuss workplace violence and its warning signs, discuss what actions you should take, review the importance of respect in the workplace, and review how associates can keep our company a safe and friendly place to work.Language: English
Supplier: Internal
Location: Offsite
Participants: 16 - 22
Keywords: Safety
Need help? Click here.

Title: Learning tool Situational management (EN)
Description:
Adjusting the management style in line with the employee’s development level.

Can you tell the difference between different employees regarding to what extent they are capable and prepared to carry out their tasks? Do you wonder how to deal with these different levels? Do you wonder how you can adjust your management style in line with this? Then read this tool about situational management. The model can help to you acquire more insight into the behaviour which is expected of you, as the manager, where the employee’s situation is concerned. It provides an insight into the way in which you can effectively manage people. The tool also includes a test which you can use to find your preferred style.

The method
A manager’s behaviour is viewed on two dimensions with situational management. Controlling and supportive. Four different management styles are created by combining these two types:

S1 instructing
S2 convincing
S3 discussing
S4 delegating

You can apply these styles in line with the employee’s level of task maturity. Employees are arranged into four levels, which you subsequently apply the correct management style to. These four levels are:

D1 low level of competency, high level of involvement
D2 low level of competency, low level of involvement
D3 High level of competency, low level of involvement
D4 High level of competency, high level of involvement.

Required time
It will take approximately 15 minutes to read through this tool. Completing the test will take around 10 minutes.

Title: Learning tool Kolb’s learning cycle (EN)
Description:
Effectively learning to go through all the learning cycle’s phases.

Why does it seem like learning can sometimes go so smoothly and yet at other times it all seems a bit of a struggle? Are you curious about the best way of learning for you? Or would you like to know what would be the best way for your employees to learn? Then read through this tool about Kolb’s learning cycle. The tool will teach you to understand the use of the learning cycle, the different learning styles available and the best way of dealing with these in order to be learning effectively. The tool also includes a test which you can complete to discover your own learning style.

The method
Kolb’s learning cycle describes four phases which you need to go through in order to start learning effectively:

- Experiencing
- Reflecting
- Theorising
- Experimenting

Dependent on your own preferred learning style, you will subconsciously start with one of these phases in learning situations:

- Doer
- Dreamer
- Decider
- Thinker

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through this tool. Completing the test will also take around 10 minutes.

Title: Learning tool Brief absence consultation (EN)
Description:
Discussing absences with your employee and subsequently jointly arriving at appropriate agreements.

Do you know how to enter into discussions with employees who often call in sick within a relatively short period of time? How can you tell whether someone is really ill or perhaps just feeling demotivated? How do you structure an absence consultation? This tool will help you to prepare and conduct brief absence consultations.

The method
Conversations are structured in accordance with the head-body-tail method and the same applies to brief absence consultations. This tool will provide you with a step by step guide as to how a brief absence consultation should be structured. This will enable you to conduct an effective conversation. We have also provided you with a checklist which you can use to prepare for the meeting.

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through this tool.

Title: Learning tool Johari window (EN)
Description:
Map out how you want to come across and how others perceive you.

A very useful aid when giving and receiving feedback. It will help you to become aware of matters you weren’t yet aware of, your so-called blind spot. Would you like to find out more? Then read through this tool and discover how it all works.

The method
The Johari window will enable you to find out which of your characteristics are in the public domain and which ones aren’t in four different areas. You can use this information to decide how you want to and don’t want to come across. The areas concerned are:

- The open space or free area
- The private area or hidden area
- The blind spot
- The subconscious, unknown self

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through this tool.

Title: Learning tool CAD method (EN)
Description:
Structure for reaching decisions in a meeting or discussion.

Have you noticed that it’s quite difficult to reach a decision during a meeting? Do you know those types of decisions which everyone appears to agree with, but which no one fulfils or executes? Or those moments in a meeting when people are completely indecisive? The CAD method will provide you with a structure which will make reaching decisions in a meeting much easier.

The method
The CAD method is a method which describes three decision making phases during meetings. CAD stands for:

- Conceptualisation phase
- Assessment phase
- Decision making phase

Using and properly completing these phases will result in decisions which are more acceptable to the participants and will therefore actually be executed.

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through this tool.

Title: Learning tool Head-body-tail model (EN)
Description:
A model which can help you to prepare your communication in a structured manner.

Would you like to make sure your audience understands you? Would you like to write a well structured text? Or do you sometimes find it difficult to effectively prepare for a conversation or presentation? Then use this tool. It includes a method which will ensure you can realise a structured and understandable information transfer. This will help you with both written and verbal communication.

The method
The head-body-tail model brings structure to your communication. The tool provides a detailed description for the following three steps:

Head: the beginning.
Body: the actual message.
Tail: the conclusion.

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through the tool.

Title: Learning tool LSQ method (EN)
Description:
A method to give your discussion partner your undivided attention during communication.

Does this sound familiar? You are talking to a colleague or employee and he feels understood. He really feels you are listening to him properly. He thanks you for this and you can also tell by his non-verbal behaviour. You will undoubtedly also have experienced the complete opposite; your discussion partner doesn’t feel understood. He says the following in an irritated tone: are you actually listening to me? Or: No, that’s not at all what I meant! That wasn’t what I was talking about! These are clear signals that you haven’t been listening. Even if you did actually hear what the other person said, this might not be enough. After all, hearing is something completely different than listening. So how do you listen properly?

Would you like answers to these questions? Then read through the tool about the LSQ method. The tool provides detailed information regarding the three skills, exactly what the LSQ method entails and how you can use it. There is also a self test which you can use check whether you are applying the following three skills.

The method
The LSQ method is a method you can use to show your employee, colleague or other discussion partner that you are actively listening. Actively listening means: giving someone your undivided attention, showing an interest in what the other person thinks, feels and may have experienced. The person talking wants to know the listener is paying attention to him and understands him. This confirmation can be provided in three different ways.

- Listening: by nodding, making eye contact, humming
- Summarising: showing that you, the listener, understand what the speaker has said
- Questioning: asking questions which show you are interested.

Required time
It will take approximately 10-15 minutes to read through this tool. Completing the test will take around 10 minutes.

Title: Learning tool Career values (EN)
Description:
Becoming aware of your motives and the things you find important in your work.

What kind of work do I find appealing? What are my criteria when I make a choice? What kind of colleagues do I prefer working with? What do I want my working conditions to be like? What do I give priority to? What aspect of my work makes me feel appreciated? This tool will tell you all about your values and how this can give direction to your career. The tool explains what career values are and it also includes two exercises which you can get to grips with.

The method
Career values can help you to manage your own career. You can go through the following process when you are working on your career, consisting of three steps:

- Values
- Choosing
- Doing

Following this process will allow you to find out what your motives are in your work, as well as the things which really matter to you.

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through this tool. Completing the exercises will take around 20 minutes.

Title: OUT OF SERVICE Deli Associate Training (Server Version Feb 8)

To ensure consistency in specified Learning Objectives, Computer Based Training (CBT), a form of e-learning, will be utilized in combination with other training formats.  CBT will provide a generalized overview of the many areas in our stores. Topics covered in Deli are as follows:

2. Remarkable Customer Service

4. Food Safety and Associate Safety

7. Shrink

Title: Learning tool Project-based working (EN)
Description:
The structured execution of activities which leads to a predetermined end result.

So what do we really mean when we talk about project-based working? And what does this involve? When do you use it? You can read the project-based working tool for answers to these questions. The tool explains exactly what a project is, how project-based working can be applied and which phase you are going through.

The method
Project-based working is used when a project team is working on a predetermined end result. You work in accordance with a structure and thereby go through all the different project phases:

- Initiation phase
- Definition phase
- Execution phase
- Aftercare and evaluation phase

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through this tool.

Title: Learning tool The McKinsey 7 S model (EN)
Description:
A model to analyse or define an organisation’s most important elements.

Would you like to know how you can effectively organise an organisation? Are you curious about the various different factors which effectively organised companies use? Would you like to acquire a better insight into the way in which you can analyse whether your organisation is effective? Then read this tool about the McKinsey 7 S model. The tool explains how the model has been structured and how it can be applied.

The method
The McKinsey 7 S model consists of 7 factors which determine whether or not a company is effectively organised. These elements are:

- Shared values
- Strategy
- Structure
- Systems
- Management styles
- Key skills
- Staff

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through this tool.

Title: Learning tool De Bono’s thinking styles (EN)
Description:
A method for looking at situations or problems from a different perspective.

Do you find that meetings don’t always run that smoothly? Do discussions go in all sorts of different directions without any structure, whilst important subjects remain underexposed? Do you get the feeling that people come to a meeting with an established opinion regarding a problem and can therefore no longer look at the problem from a different perspective? De Bono’s six thinking styles can help you look at problems from a different perspective. It’s like you’re wearing a different hat. This tool will teach you which thinking direction you can choose and how you can do this during a meeting. You can also learn to use this method individually to prepare for a difficult issue by going through some step by step instructions.

The method
The six thinking styles described by De Bono are linked to colours. The colour of the thinking style indicates from which direction you are approaching a problem:

- Blue, contemplative, controlling, keeps his cool.
- Red, feelings, intuition, reacts emotionally.
- Black, negative, pessimistic, is critical.
- Yellow, positive, optimistic, is a constructive thinker.
- Green, creative, associative, thinks outside the box.
- White, objective, thinks from actual facts.

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through this tool. Completing the exercise will take around 15 minutes.

Title: Learning tool PDCA circle (EN)
Description:
A model which will allow you to continuously improve processes.

Are actions planned and executed, but are adjustments often overlooked? Do you see continuous improvements at the moment? And if not, why not? Are lessons learnt from mistakes, or is there a constant pressure to immediately start something new? This tool will teach you how to ensure results are realised, but also how we can learn and therefore continuously work on improving processes.

The method
The PDCA circle stands for:

PLAN
DO
CHECK
ACT

Following these four steps means you can produce plans, follow them up, organise interim assessments and conclude with a good evaluation based on what you have learnt. This allows us to continuously improve processes.

Required time
It will take approximately 10 minutes to read through this tool.

Title: LEF
Description:
De workshop LEF (Liever Eerst Feiten) gaat in op je eigen belemmerende gedachten. 

Onze gedachten beïnvloeden hoe we ons voelen en dat leidt tot het wel of niet in actie komen. We denken dat onze gevoelens gebaseerd zijn op de situatie, maar het is onze eigen beeld van de situatie die ons gevoel bepaalt. Ofwel: wat wij denken over de situatie bepaalt hoe we handelen. Onze inschatting van de situatie vindt plaats op basis van onze overtuigingen over onszelf, anderen en situaties. Enkele overtuigingen zijn bijvoorbeeld: ‘Ik ben te oud”, ‘Niemand wil mij hebben’, ‘Ik vind nooit meer zo’n leuke baan’ en ‘Anderen zijn slimmer dan ik’. Deze overtuigingen sturen onze acties zonder dat we het onszelf bewust zijn. Door ons bewust te worden van onze onbewuste overtuigingen, kunnen we deze toetsen aan de feiten. 

Veruit de meeste deelnemers sluiten deze workshop af met een aantal concrete voornemens voor de toekomst.

*Deze workshop is alleen bedoeld voor HRservices medewerkers*

Title: Sollicitatie technieken
Description:
De workshop Sollicitatietechnieken zal voornamelijk in het teken staan van het aangaan van open sollicitaties. 

Hoe pak je dat nu het beste aan? Op welke manier stel je je mondelinge en eventueel schriftelijke motivatie op? Op welke manier voer je een open sollicitatiegesprek? Als er geen concrete vacature voor handen is, wat bespreek je dan in het gesprek? Daarnaast zal de opbouw van (open) sollicitatiebrieven aan de orde komen. 

Indien mogelijk gegeven de tijd zal een eerste vertaalslag worden gemaakt naar het opstellen van het recurring course vitae.

*Deze workshop is alleen bedoeld voor HRservices medewerkers*

Title: Kiezen motiveert
Description:
De workshop Kiezen Motiveert leert mensen hun twijfels over hun loopbaankeuze om te zetten in concrete keuzes. 

Het bewust maken van de voor- en nadelen van verschillende keuzes, helpt de deelnemer om een realistisch beeld te krijgen van de verschillende opties en op basis hiervan een goed afgewogen keuze te maken. Het is van belang om vast te stellen wat je eigen verwachtingen zijn. Als je zelf er voldoende van overtuigd bent dat de inspanningen de moeite waard zijn en je een realistisch beeld hebt van wat je te wachten staat, zal je eerder bereid zijn je er voor in te zetten en meer doorzettingsvermogen hebben. We onderzoeken in deze workshop wat het vinden van een nieuwe functie aantrekkelijk maakt en we verkleinen de barrières. 

Ook zullen ´careerstyles´ aan de orde komen, om een gerichte keuze voor de toekomst verder te ondersteunen.

*Deze workshop is alleen bedoeld voor HRservices medewerkers*

Title: People Care

Dalším tématem je HR je klíčový faktor ve firmě – vy jej máte ve svých rukou a rozvojový program šitý na míru pro HR manažery.

Title: Selectiegesprekken voor Teamleiders
Description:
Binnen Albert Heijn wordt veel tijd besteed aan het aannemen van nieuwe medewerkers. Om de retentie te verhogen is er meer aandacht nodig voor het voeren van selectiegesprekken. Tijdens het selectieproces zal de focus liggen bij de competenties die nodig zijn voor de functie.

De doelgroep voor deze workshop zijn de teamleiders verkoopklaar en verkoopafhandeling.

De deelnemers aan deze workshop hebben vooraf het teamleiderstraject gevolgd. Over het algemeen hebben zij leidinggevende ervaring en hebben zij al selectiegesprekken gevoerd. De deelnemers komen uit verschillende winkels.

De basisvaardigheden die van belang zijn voor het voeren van selectiegesprekken (en die geacht worden bekend te zijn): Luisteren Samenvatten Doorvragen (LSD), Communicatie model, Waarnemen en interpreteren, Kop-Romp-Staart model.

Na afloop van de workshop is de teamleider in staat om:
* Een selectiegesprek te voeren met behulp van de STAR-Methodiek.
* Competentiegericht te selecteren.
* Nieuwe medewerkers te selecteren die passen binnen de functie en het team.

Uitgangspunten:
* De training sluit aan bij de voorkennis en de ervaring van de deelnemers.
* Gebaseerd op de praktijk en verbonden aan de praktijk.
* Principe van ervarend leren. Hierdoor gaan de nieuwe competenties leven en worden voorbeeldgedragingen duidelijk.
* Eigen verantwoordelijkheid van de individuele deelnemer.

De workshop wordt begeleid door een trainer en een acteur.

Title: Den s Albertem
Albert Akademie - Seznamovací seminář pro SM
Description:
Jedná se o dvoudenní program pro manažery prodejen v programu ALBERT AKADEMIE. Jeho cílem je poskytnout novým manažerům co nejvíce informací, které mohou později ve své funkci využít a současně jim dát možnost seznámit se s kolegy, kteří čerstvě nastoupili na pozice jak v operativě, tak na centrále a distribučních centrech.



Každý účastník musí být minimálně ve II.fázi programu.



1.den - akce Den s Albertem - program pro nové zaměstnance všech formátů (SO, DC, Ops) - vhled do fungování různých oddělení společnosti, propojení se vzájemným poznáním nových kolegů.

Večer - večeře s VP ops a top managementem.



2. den - již pouze pro manažery prodejen v programu ALBERT AKADEMIE (bez ostatních formátů) - den s odděleními operační podpory - případové studie, diskuze, prezentace na roli manažera prodejny v rámci personallistiky.

 

Klíčová slova:

akademie, Albert Day, albert akademie seminář, seminář albert akademie

Title: Projektové řízení pro budoucí projektové manažery
Description:
Short introduction: How to proceed to sucees as a project manager? Where to start, what not to forget, what is important? What is my responsibility and who can help me? How to handle risks? Answers for these and another questions will be figured out collectivelly during a two-days course of project management for future project leaders.

Course topics:

- get acquinted dwith basic principles and tools of project management

- on a case study you will try practical application of some tools for strategy creation and project planning

- gain inspiration for documentation management

Title: Welcome to Ahold Europe
Description:
The Welcome to Ahold Europe meeting is held every six weeks and is part of the introduction process for all new employees working for Ahold Europe and its brands.
Employees will register themselves on specific date/time.


The meeting consists of two parts: the first part will be a do it yourself tour around the office, together with the other new employees. You will be playing an iPad game, in which you will discover the Ahold Europe organization. In the second part you will be meeting an HR Business partner.

Learning objectives:
- get to know Ahold Europe and its brands
- find your way in the Ahold Europe organization and in your office location
- introduction in HR-related topics
- meet colleagues and / or expand your personal network.

Target group
- All employees who start working in the support offices of Ahold Europe or its brands
- All new higher personnel employees at Ahold Europe and its brands;
- HR business partners from support office and operations organization;
- Interns of the Ahold Europe support office organization.

Course outline
- History of Ahold Europe and its brands
- Ahold Europe organization
- People Performance and other HR related topics

Course type: Classroom with activities
Language: English, or in the local language, dependent of the participants
Duration: 09.00 – 13.30, including lunch or 13.00 - 17.30.
When: On Monday every 2 weeks, dependent on number of participants (minimum 2, maximum 10)
Min-max groupsize: 2-10
Location: in Zaandam office and Prague office
Costs: No costs included

Procedure to enroll: This training is organized only when the minimum number of participants have been met. Every participant must register him/herself In ELM for the desired date. Ahold Competency Awareness VP
Description:
30 minutes

Introduction of Ahold Values and Competencies for Ahold Executives.

Our strategy tells us where we are going, our core values tell us what we stand for, and our core capabilities tell us what we need to be good at to make a difference. Our strategy, core values, and core capabilities are crucially interdependent and drive our actions, decisions and communication with each other and our customers. To ensure that we act accordingly, we have developed a set of competencies that describe the behaviors we need in our organization.

A competency is a personal quality, visible and measurable in behavior, which is a qualifi cation for excellent performance. Competencies tell us what behavior supports realizing our strategy and living according to our core values.

Title: Orientace na zákazníka (Junior)
Description:
Introduction:

How do I know what my customer wants? And what to do when even he does not know exactly? How to convince and inspire others for my idea? These and other interesting answers can be found in a two-day course focused on the customer orientation. The course focuses at acquiring and practicing skills in order to understand of what is your level of customer orientation and how you can develop it based on your position. The learning methods used will be not only lectures, these will rather play a minor role, but the emphasis is put on practice, hence video making and its analysis. The content and methods of the course for juniors and seniors differ slightly. The difference is in some scenarios and experiences shared by the participants.

Objectives:

To  learn how to find out what the customer wants (both internal and external) and also to learn what to do in situations when even he does not know exactly
To find out how to persuade and inspire others for an idea
To broaden knowledge in the area of customer orientation and its application in practice

Target Group:

Employees in both in managerial and non-managerial positions who need to gain knowledge and skills in the area of customer orientation. Based on experience, competencies and responsibilities please enroll in the course for juniors or seniors.

Main Topics:

Caste study - check your abilities related to customer orientation
Effective techniques to identify the needs and to develop understanding of the others
Get inspired by Steve Jobs and his tips for persuasive presentation of your ideas and solutions
Learn how to solve complicated negotiating situations with internal customers by understanding the emotions
Communication techniques as a basic tool for for building constructive work relationships

Duration of the training:                     2 days

Min-max number of participants:       8 - 15 participants

Language:                                           Czech

Supplier:                                             External training agency Image lab

Location:                                            Ahold location (internal training room)

Overnight Stay:                                   No / Based on standard request

Costs:  According to the number of participants. These costs will be charged on your department cost center; even when you are not attending the course - based on a late apology (14 days and less before the date of the training).

Title: Pro Actief in Talent (PIT)
Description:
Workshop Pro-actief in talent (PIT)
In essentie komt deze workshop neer op het ontwikkelen van vaardigheden om positief in te kunnen spelen op verandering en om positieve ontmoetingen te kunnen bewerkstelligen.
Om te kunnen ontmoeten moet je jezelf kenbaar maken. Jezelf laten zien. Iets wat voor de toekomstige generatie al min of meer vanzelfsprekend is. Denk maar aan twitter en hyves. Maar ook van huidige medewerkers wordt een omslag verwacht. Overtuigingen als: 'bescheidenheid siert de mens', 'als je je werk maar goed doet, komt het goed' of 'ze weten toch wat ik kan' komen ineens ter discussie te staan en blijken niet altijd meer te werken.
Het PIT programma is bedoeld om hulp te bieden bij de gevraagde omslag, zodat frustratie (en daarmee juist een daling van pit) wordt voorkomen.
PIT doet dit door:
– deelnemers bewust te maken van hun talent en de meerwaarde daarvan voor organisaties;
– deelnemers te stimuleren hun talent zichtbaar te maken.

*Deze workshop is alleen bedoeld voor HRservices medewerkers*

Title: Hef-/reachtruck opleiding voor Chauffeurs
Description:
Deze training leidt de deelnemer op tot gecertificeerd Hef- en/of Reachtruck chauffeur. De training bestaat uit 2 dagen,een dag theorie en een dag praktijk. De training wordt op de eigen locatie gehouden en georganiseerd door Interne Trainers. Deze trainers zijn EVO gecertificeerd.

Binnen ongeveer 4 weken na de training wordt de deelnemer beoordeeld (theorie en praktijk) door een gediplomeerde docent van EVO. Bij een positieve beoordeling ontvangt de deelnemer het wettelijk erkende EVO Veiligheidscertificaat Heftruckchauffer met de aantekening Vorkheftruck en/of Reachtruck. De Interne Trainer neemt contact op met EVO voor het vastleggen van de toetsdatum. Op een dag kunnen maximaal 8 personeen worden getoetst.

Het certificaat heeft een geldigheidsduur van 5 jaar. Na vijf jaar volgt de chauffeur een eendaagse herhalingstraining.

Title: Reachtruck opleiding - Trainer Interne Transportmiddelen
Description:
Leer anderen hoe te werken met de reachtruck. 

De training leidt de deelnemer op tot gecertificeerd Trainer Interne Transportmiddelen (Reachtruck). Het traject bestaat uit een intake van 2 dagen, bestaande uit theorie en praktijk, gevolgd door een opleiding van 4 dagen. De deelnemer wordt gecoached en begeleid door een gediplomeerde EVO docent. De intake vindt plaats in het trainingscentrum van EVO te Zoetermeer. De training is InCompany.

De training wordt afgesloten met een wettelijk erkend certificaat (geldigheidsduur is 3 jaar). Na drie jaar volgt de Trainer een herhaalcursus. EVO voert jaarlijks per site een observatie uit om de kwaliteit van de training te toetsen.

Leverancier: EVO (079 - 346 7337, elosales@evo.nl)

Deelnemers: 1 - 6

Factuurinformatie: EVO verstuurt factuur aan budgethouder logistiek o.v.v. Naam, Adres en Code. Factuurcode: AH = NL024 - 208105-475001 t.l.v. M. van Grinsven / Etos = NL014 - 302240-501500 t.l.v. Tom Rood

Description: Medicare D Module 2: Coverage and Access

Title: In je kracht
Description:
In deze 2 daagse training (inclusief avond en overnachting) staat persoonlijk leiderschap centraal. Hoe haal je het beste uit jezelf en uit je team? Op basis van de persoonlijke kwaliteiten, overtuigingen en drijfveren wordt gewerkt aan ieders persoonlijke ambitie in leven en werk. Het gaat hier vooral over jouw zelfbewustzijn. We gaan gezamenlijk op onderzoek uit naar wat jou inspireert. 
Leerdoelen van de training
• De leidinggevende vergroot de zelfkennis over de effectiviteit van hun functioneren
• De leidinggevende is zich bewust van zijn kernkwaliteiten.
• De leidinggevende kent zijn drijfveren
• De leidinggevende is in staat te reflecteren op hun eigen gedrag.
• De leidinggevende is in staat een heldere ambitie te formuleren voor zichzelf in relatie tot de eigen winkel / in lange termijn te denken
• De leidinggevende weet om te gaan met overtuigingen. 
• De leidinggevende vergroot het netwerk met collega’s elders in de organisatie door middel van contactuele vaardigheden.

Doelgroep:
Leidinggevenden van AHOLD, te weten: Etos Winkelmanagers, Franchise ondernemers, Winkelmanagers Gall & Gall, Teamleiders AH.

Voorbereiding:
Na aanmelding ontvang je een voorbereidingsopdracht met theoretische achtergrond en informatie voor tijdens de training. Het maken van de voorbereidingsopdracht is een ingangseis om deel te nemen aan de open training.

Title: Omgaan met weerstand in gesprekken
Description:
In persoonlijke gesprekken die je met medewerkers voert, zul je soms ook veranderingen moeten bespreken die weerstand oproepen. Denk bijvoorbeeld aan wijzigingen in de formatie, werkprocessen of gedrag. Deze veranderingen zijn nodig voor het succes en voortbestaan onze organisatie.
Tijdens de training staat centraal welke gesprekstechnieken je kunt inzetten om de verandering bij je medewerker geaccepteerd te krijgen. 

Na de training ben je in staat om:
• de emotionele fasen van verandering te herkennen en te begrijpen;
• om te gaan met weerstanden, gevoelens en aannames van medewerkers en van jezelf; 
• de LSD-methode en de structuur van slecht nieuws brengen effectief toe te passen;
• verschillende beïnvloedingsstijlen toe te passen en weet je wanneer je deze in het omgaan met veranderingen en weerstand effectief kan toepassen.
   
Duur van de training 
Eén halve dag (1 dagdeel)

Globaal programma van de training 
Tijdens dit  dagdeel wordt er met een acteur geoefend met verschillende gesprekken die in het teken van veranderingen staan. We gaan in op de veranderingscurve, kortom de fases waarin jij zelf, maar ook je medewerkers komen als een verandering zich voordoet. Verder kijken we naar wat jij kan doen in deze fases in de gesprekken met je medewerkers. Je leert om te gaan met emoties en weerstand.  

Doelgroep
Leidinggevenden van AHOLD, te weten: Etos Winkelmanagers, Franchise ondernemers, Winkelmanagers Gall & Gall, Teamleiders AH , Teamleiders Logistics.

Voorbereiding
Na aanmelding ontvang je een voorbereidingsopdracht met theoretische achtergrond en informatie voor tijdens de training. Het maken van de voorbereidingsopdracht is een ingangseis om deel te nemen aan de open training.

Title: Selectiegesprekken
Description:
Ahold wil natuurlijk de juiste persoon op de juiste plek; dat scheelt een hoop tijd en geld. Het maken van een goede beslissing in een selectiegesprek is dan ook een belangrijke, maar vaak lastige taak: sollicitanten doen zich soms anders voor dan ze zijn en zijn ook steeds beter voorbereid op moeilijke vragen. Degene die het interview afneemt, dient hier rekening mee te houden. Door jezelf op het gesprek voor te bereiden en juist die vragen te stellen waar sollicitanten zich niet op kunnen voorbereiden, kun je erachter komen wie er precies tegenover je zit. Deze training helpt je daarbij.

In dit dagdeel training krijg je technieken aangereikt om op een gefundeerde wijze de inhoudelijke expertise en de persoonlijkheid van de kandidaten vast te stellen. Je leert doelgericht te werk te gaan. Daarbij bekijken we hoe je vragen kunt stellen die niet voorbereid kunnen worden en dus veel informatie opleveren. Na afloop van de training ben je beter in staat om effectieve selectiegesprekken af te nemen en je een beter en scherper beeld te vormen van de sollicitant.

Leerdoel tijdens de training Selectiegesprekken is het stellen van een helder doel, het aanbrengen van een goede gespreksstructuur. Na de training ben je als leidinggevende in staat om:
• Een selectiegesprek te voeren met behulp van de STAR-methode
• Competentiegericht te selecteren
• Nieuwe medewerkers te selecteren die passen binnen de functie en het team.

Duur van de training 
Eén halve dag (1 dagdeel)

Doelgroep:
Leidinggevenden van AHOLD, te weten: Etos Winkelmanagers, Franchise ondernemers, Winkelmanagers Gall & Gall, Teamleiders AH.

Voorbereiding:
Na aanmelding ontvang je een voorbereidingsopdracht met theoretische achtergrond en informatie voor tijdens de training. Het maken van de voorbereidingsopdracht is een ingangseis om deel te nemen aan de training.

Title: Voortgangs- en beoordelingsgesprek
Description:
Voortgangs- of beoordelingsgesprekken voeren is voor jou als leidinggevende een belangrijke taak die medebepalend is voor je resultaten. Je medewerkers horen graag hoe je tegen hun prestaties aankijkt. Ben je tevreden over de behaalde resultaten en de wijze waarop deze behaald zijn? Welke competenties zouden eigenlijk verder ontwikkeld moeten worden? En weet je dat goed over te brengen in een gesprek?
In deze training leer je dit te bespreken met je medewerkers. Je maakt samen met jouw medewerkers afspraken en creëert effectief werkgedrag dat bepalend is voor hoge resultaten. Je streeft er naar je medewerkers niet zozeer‘af te rekenen’, maar samen op een ontwikkelingsgerichte wijze resultaten te behalen en hun talenten te benutten. 

Na de training ben je in staat om:
• een voortgangs- en een beoordelingsgesprek op effectieve wijze te voeren;
• verschillende stijlen van leidinggeven effectief toe te passen;
• om te gaan met weerstanden, gevoelens en aannames van je medewerkers en van jezelf in een voortgangsgesprek of beoordelingsgesprek.
• methodes als SMART en STAR in te zetten

Duur van de training 
Eén halve dag (1 dagdeel)

Globaal programma
Tijdens de training wordt er met een acteur geoefend met verschillende voortgangs- en beoordelingsgesprekken. We gaan in op situaties uit jouw werkpraktijk. Dit kan variëren van gesprekken met je toptalenten maar ook met vastlopers uit je team. Ook komen de diverse gesprekken aanbod, dit varieert van A tot E beoordelingen. 

Doelgroep
Leidinggevenden van AHOLD: Etos Winkelmanagers, Franchise ondernemers, Winkelmanagers Gall & Gall, Teamleiders AH .

Voorbereiding
Na aanmelding ontvang je een voorbereidingsopdracht met theoretische achtergrond en informatie voor tijdens de training. Het maken van de voorbereidingsopdracht is een ingangseis om deel te nemen aan de open training.

Learn valuable tools to manage and motivate leverage suppliers through competition using indexed contracts

Title: Managing Inclusion
Description:
he Managing Inclusion program addresses a common business reality:  that most people are capable of contributing at high levels, but sustained high performance is often only found among a subset of “go-to” people. Why? Individual belief systems, organizational structures, and company culture often create barriers to performance.
 
Managing Inclusion is designed to make exceptional performance a reality. You’ll learn to identify, address, and bypass your bias, and in doing so, find you can increase the levels of “go-to” performance on your team, engage all employees in continuous learning and improvement, and impact the bottom line.
 
As we face the challenges of our current market, we need to stop relying on “go-to” people and create go-to teams. I am sure you will find this a very valuable experience.

He or she can help you decide which modules are or are not relevant for you. Costs for learning activities (including travel and location costs) always have to be approved by your manager.

HR Recurring course contains modules provided by internal trainers, in-company modules provided by external trainers and open offer from training companies. There are also elearnings available and “on the job” knowledge obtainment modules. For specific information about the modules; see ELM descriptions. Note that you will find generic personal development modules in “algemeen aanbod”. Note that not all modules are available for other than Dutch participants yet. Title: Confined Space Acknowledgment
Description: This course will inform Associates about the potentially hazardous spaces found within our stores.  This course will also educate Associates about OSHA policy: Confined Spaces (1910.146).

Title: Vyjednávání pro zaměstnance M,F&M 2
Description:
V tréninkových programech, zaměřených na vyjednávání v obchodě, se soustřeďujeme na ověření základních znalostí a dovedností a velmi rychle směřujeme k pokročilým vyjednávacím disciplínám, zejména potom ke strategickým tématům (jak kombinovat vyjednávací styly), přípravě na vyjednávání, analýze moci a zájmů, sebepoznání a zvládání stresu a - to zcela nejvíce - poznávání partnerů z hlediska jejich osobnosti, myšlení, dovedností a návyků, analýze jejich neverbální komunikace a využití těchto znalostí a dovedností v obchodní praxi. A pochopitelně nácvik vyjednávání v praxi na praktických příkladech, včetně zvládání vybraných obtížných situací.

Průběh školení

Poznávání a ovlivňování lidí, zájmů a mocenských aspektů vyjednávání
- Poznávání lidí z pohledu jejich motivů, hodnot a zájmů
- Poznávání lidí z pohledu jejich komunikačních, vztahových a vyjednávacích preferencí
- Sebepoznání a důsledky sebepoznání pro vyjednávání s partnery různých zaměření
- Příprava na vyjednávání, analýza moci a zájmů, definice vyjednávacího prostoru
- Stanovení vyjednávacích taktik a tvorba alternativních scénářů
- Práce s tlakem a informacemi, získávání informací od protistrany

Vyjednávání v nezvyklých a obtížných podmínkách
- Vyjednávání v nerovných podmínkách (včetně vyjednávání v podmínkách dominance)
- Zvládání konfliktních a problémových typů vyjednavačů
- Analýza neverbální komunikace, poznávání a zvládání vyjednávacích triků
- Strategické cíle a strategicky výhodný styl vyjednávání
- Kombinace vyjednávacích stylů s cílem nastavit strategicky výhodný typ vztahů
- Zvládání zátěže a stresu při vyjednávání v obtížných podmínkách

Title: Personal productivity
Description:
"In deze korte training krijg je handvatten om meer grip te krijgen op je eigen werk en op de hoeveelheid informatie die tot je komt. De training is incompany, praktisch van opzet, gaat uit van een persoonlijke benadering en wordt één op één gegeven .Afspraken vinden tussen de reguliere werkzaamheden plaats.

Doel: het optimaliseren van de persoonlijke productiviteit door het werk te organiseren en uit te voeren met een up-to-date overzicht van het eigen werk.
Resultaat:
·   Meer focus op uit te voeren taken, wat de kwaliteit van het werk ten goede komt.
·   Omschakeling van Reactief naar Proactief.
·   Meerdere malen per dag een lege inbox.
·   Veel minder onnodige ""last minute"" crisisacties, die stress met zich meebrengen, onnodig capaciteit vragen van de omgeving en ten koste gaan van de kwaliteit van het werk.
·   Een groter gevoel van controle over het eigen werk.

De training bestaat uit 4 sessies (eerste 1,5u, daarna 3x 'n uur met ca 1 week tussen elke afspraak). Tussendoor zelf aan de slag en evt telefonisch contact.

Benodigde voorkennis: geen

Taal: Engels / Nederlands 

Leverancier: Michel Huigen, HU!G Consultancy

Locatie: op je werkplek

Kosten: € 695,-- per persoon. Deze kosten worden doorbelast op het kostenplaatsnummer van je afdeling.
                            
Min-max groepsomvang:  nvt

Aanmeldingsprocedure: Na goedkeuring van je manager kun je je rechtstreeks inschrijven bij de leverancier. Zorg ervoor dat je bij de aanmelding de juiste factuurgegevens vermeldt (factuuradres en kostenplaats van je eigen afdeling NL…-475001- …). Deze gegevens zijn bekend bij je leidinggevende.

Trefwoorden: Persoonlijke ontwikkeling, Persoonlijke effectiviteit, Time Management, tijdmanagement, slimmer werken, lege inbox, mailverwerking, organiseren van werk, persoonlijke productiviteit"

Title: Požární hlídky
Description: Školení je určeno pro zaměstnance, kteří jsou jmenováni do funkce člena preventivní požární hlídky. Budete seznámeni s organizací požární ochrany na pracovišti - způsob vyhlášení požárního poplachu a ohlášení požáru zaměstnancům, vedoucím osobám a dalším osobám. Dále s předpisy pro zabezpečení konkrétní akce nebo činnosti , budete proškoleni na hasicí přístroje, hydranty, evakuační a zásahové cesty a evakuace osob a materiálu.

Title: Preventista požární ochrany
Description: Školení je určeno pro zaměstnance, kteří jsou jmenováni do funkce preventisty požární ochrany. Budete seznámeni s organizací požární ochrany, požární bezpečností staveb, elektrozažízení a tepelných spotřebičů. Dále se dozvíte o požárním poplachu, evakuaci osob a majetku a jak provádět preventivní požární prohlídky.

Title: LinkedIn
Description:
In de huidige arbeidsmarkt is het belangrijk je als medewerker te kunnen onderscheiden van anderen door jezelf te profileren (= zichtbaar te maken). Functies liggen niet meer vast, dienstverbanden worden losser en flexibeler. 

De arbeidsmarkt is een ontmoetingsplaats geworden tussen de behoefte van organisaties en de bijdrage van medewerkers. Netwerken worden steeds belangrijker en steeds vaker wordt hierbij gebruik gemaakt van sociale netwerksites (Hyves, Twitter, LinkedIn). LinkedIn is de snelst groeiende sociale netwerksite in Nederland voor zakelijk gebruik. Daarnaast staat LinkedIn bekend als zéér betrouwbaar. De kracht van LinkedIn is, dat jij als gebruiker zelf jouw 'werkprofiel' bepaalt. Je bent zelf de beheerder van jouw profiel en bepaalt wat erin komt te staan, wat er zichtbaar is en voor wie. In Nederland wordt LinkedIn vooral gebruikt door werkenden en recruiters/selecteurs en leidinggevenden bij bedrijven. In deze workshop van een dagdeel (ochtend of middag) krijgt men uitleg over hoe men een profiel maakt op LinkedIn, hoe LinkedIn wordt gebruikt en krijgt men tips hoe je het zelf het beste kunt gebruiken, zodat je de mogelijkheden die LinkedIn biedt optimaal kunt gaan benutten.

*Deze workshop is alleen bedoeld voor HRservices medewerkers*

Training onderhandelen over arbeidsvoorwaarden
Description:
Tijdens de cursus staan de volgende vragen centraal:
• hoe bereid ik het onderhandelingsproces voor?
• hoe kan ik dit proces doelmatig, beheerst en gestructureerd laten verlopen?
• hoe creëer ik een optimale onderhandelingssfeer?
• hoe is mijn eigen onderhandelingsgedrag en wat zijn de effecten hiervan op het proces?
• hoe kan ik de nazorg zorgvuldig vormgeven?
Tot slot besteedt de cursus bijzondere aandacht aan de ontwikkeling van het besef wat haalbaar en realistisch is. 

De training wordt verzorgd door AWVN. De complete cursusinhoud en informatie over data, locatie en kosten van deze training vind je op de website van AWVN (kopieer de link in je browser) 
http://www.awvn.nl/pub/internet/Cursussen/(18542)-internet-Cursussen-Onderhandelen-over-arbeidsvoorwaarden.html

Target group: HRBP's vanuit hun functie onderhandelen met vakbonden en OR

Method: Classroom

Type of training: standard training of supplier

Location:external location

Duration:3 dagen met overnachting

Wijze van inschrijving: nadat je toestemming hebt gekregen van je leidinggevende, dien je jezelf in te schrijven bij het trainingsbureau. Zorg dat het trainingsbureau de volgende factuurgegevens gebruikt: 
naam werkmaatschappij.... 
naam kostenplaatshouder +kostenplaatsnr..... 
adresgegevens Accounting plaza (zie online het handboek Accounting Plaza).

Title: Formatiemanagement
Description:
In deze training leer je te denken vanuit talent, kijken naar het winkelbestand. De juiste persoon op de juiste plek en plaats. Hoe ga je het gesprek aan met medewerkers die je in beweging wilt krijgen.
Het oefenen van de te voeren gesprekken vormen de basis van de training Formatiemanagement 3.0 “de kracht zit in de kern”. Het creëren van de juiste balans tussen enerzijds het aansturen op resultaat (ratio) en anderzijds het verkrijgen van commitment (emotie) is de spagaat van de supermarktmanager. Inzicht in eigen beperkingen, overtuigingen, normen en waarden en die van gesprekspartner, die er vervolgens voor dienen te zorgen dat het gesprek niet op voorhand wordt ingevuld door de supermarktmanager of blijft steken in weerstand.
• Hoe te komen van ego gedrag naar authentiek gedrag om zodoende de betrokken medewerker te motiveren.
• Hard op de inhoud, zacht op de relatie.
• Het verschil tussen standpunt en belang (persoonlijk/organisatorisch

Benodigde voorkennis: voorafgaand aan de training maak je een voorbereidingsopdracht

Taal: Nederlands

Leverancier: Boertien

Locatie: Ahold locatie

Kosten: € 200,-- per persoon. Deze kosten worden doorbelast op het kostenplaatsnummer van je afdeling.
                               
Min-max groepsomvang:  5 deelnemers - 7 deelnemers

Aanmeldingsprocedure: Als er cursusdata beschikbaar zijn kun je je registreren voor een van deze data. Als er geen data beschikbaar zijn, klik je op “Rooster aanvragen” en klik onderaan op de knop “Aanvraag”. Je komt dan op de request list. De training wordt georganiseerd zodra het minimum aantal deelnemers bereikt is. Je ontvangt dan een bericht.

Title: E-learning Bezorger incl. Toets
Description:
Deze opleiding geeft jou inzicht in de werkzaamheden van de Bezorger.
Deze module bestaat uit 4 onderdelen: 
- Voorbereiding van de rit
- Op naar de klant
- Afhandeling van de orders
- Afronding van de rit
Na deze e-learning:
 - heb je inzicht in de werkzaamheden die jij uitvoert in de functie van Bezorger;
 - weet je welke stappen je neemt in de verschillende taken binnen de onderdelen 'voorbereiding van de rit', 'op naar de klant', 'afhandeling van de orders', 'afronding van de rit';
 - ken je jouw rol als Bezorger in de verschillende processen.
De opleiding bestaat uit een e-learning met een afsluitende on-line toets.
Duration: 15 min. (e-learning) + 10 min. (toets)
How to access: Klik op de button 'Start e-learning' om toegang te krijgen tot de e-learning

Title: Eindtoets Bezorger Albert
Description:
Dit is de eindtoets voor de Bezorger. Je maakt deze toets nadat je het leren op de werkplek, ofwel de opleidingsritten, hebt afgerond. Met deze vragen wordt jouw kennis getoetst van alle werkzaamheden die je als Bezorger doet. De toets bestaat uit 23 meerkeuzevragen. Je slaagt voor de toets als je 80% of meer van de vragen goed beantwoord hebt. Heel veel succes bij het maken van de toets!

Klik op de button Start content / Inhoud starten, om de toets te starten.

Title: Personal power and appearance
Description:
Short introduction: In this 3-day training you learn how others perceive you and which aspects play a role in personal appearance and communication. You learn to react better and more alert to various situations in your work. Your appearance will be more self-confidence and powerful. With your excellent self-presentation and self-knowledge you will be able to achieve personal and business goals. The training is highly interactive. With a variety of excercises you will work on your self-awareness and insight. The exercises and role plays will be analyzed on an individual level.

Language: Dutch

Supplier: The training is provided by Boertien Vergouwen Overduin. The content of the course and the information about date, location and costs can be found at the website of the training supplier (copy this link into your browser) http://www.bvo.nl/training/Persoonlijke-Kracht-en-Uitstraling.html

Procedures to enroll: After permission of your manager you can subscribe directly at the training supplier. Make sure to provide the correct details for the invoice to the supplier (billing address and cost centre of your department NL…-475001- …). Your manager has these details for you.

Keywords: Personal power personal effectiveness appearance confidence

Title: Ahold Competency Awareness VP
Description:
30 minutes

Introduction of Ahold Values and Competencies for Ahold Executives.

Our strategy tells us where we are going, our core values tell us what we stand for, and our core capabilities tell us what we need to be good at to make a difference. Our strategy, core values, and core capabilities are crucially interdependent and drive our actions, decisions and communication with each other and our customers. To ensure that we act accordingly, we have developed a set of competencies that describe the behaviors we need in our organization.

A competency is a personal quality, visible and measurable in behavior, which is a qualifi cation for excellent performance. Competencies tell us what behavior supports realizing our strategy and living according to our core values.

Title: District Director Academy
Description:
The District Director Academy 2012 was an intensive three day leadership seminar focused on three key areas: 
-Redefining Operational Excellence and Performance
-Applying Operational Excellence and Performance to Store Walks & Visits-Building Talent and Leading Teams
At a high level, the outcomes of the program were: 
-Clearly defined best practices against topics above.  Gain alignment across leadership & DDs.-Practical application of best practices by conducting store walks and developing action plans  Gain alignment on ideal Store Walks and set expectations for effective action planning-Strengthening action plans through team leadership and coaching.  Actionable ways for DDs to increase bench strength through talent development

Title: E-learning SuccessFactors pro manažery
Description:
SuccessFactors je systém k procesu řízení výkonu a potenciálu zaměstnanců v naší společnosti. Díky tomuto e-learningu se naučíte, jak tento systém používat při hodnotících rozhovorech s vašimi zaměstnanci. Kurz vám ukazuje po jednotlivých krocích, co je třeba zadat ke každé fázi procesu hodnocení:
 - Chcete-li spravovat profily svých zaměstnanců
 - Kaskádovat cíle vašim podřízeným                                                                                                                                      -  Nastavit cíle
 - Zhodnotit zaměstnance při pololetním hodnocení
 - Zhodnotit zaměstnance při ročním hodnocení
 - Potvrdit formuláře zaměstnancem a nadřízeným
 - Chcete-li zpracovat reporty k hodnocení výkonu

 
K dispozici jsou také "Rychlí pomocníci", které naleznete na stránkách Management Development: https://sites.google.com/a/ahold.com/management-development-cz/
 
Jazyk : Čeština (kurz je k dispozici také v angličtině)
 
Doba trvání kurzu: 40 minut
                                
Jak absolvovat kurz: Klikněte na "Zahájit kurz" v případě, že bude chtít absolvovat e-learning ihned. Chcete-li si kurz zadat do svého plánu školení, klikněte na "Přidat do plánu výuky".
 
Klíčová slova : SuccessFactors, faktor úspěchu, úspěch, řízení výkonu, řízení potenciálu, PM, hodnocení, pololetní hodnocení, roční hodnocení, rychlí pomocníci, hodnotící rozhovor.

Title: E-learning SuccessFactors pro zaměstnance
Description:
SuccessFactors je systém k procesu řízení výkonu a potenciálu zaměstnanců v naší společnosti. Díky tomuto e-learningu se naučíte, jak tento systém používat při hodnotícím rozhovoru s vašim nadřízeným. Kurz vám ukazuje po jednotlivých krocích, co je třeba zadat ke každé fázi procesu hodnocení:
