Title: Managing Through Conflict in the Organization
Description: This course equips you with the strategies, tactics, and insights you need to gain control of tough conflict situations.  You'll discover how to spot potential interpersonal conflicts-and defuse them before they flare up.  You will learn how to:  transform conflict into a positive, productive force; respond to on-the-job conflicts quickly and effectively; understand the difference between organizational and interpersonal conflict; separate people from issues and focus on interests, not positions; get beyond immediate tensions and disagreements to the root causes of any interpersonal conflict; apply five sure-fire conflict-resolution approaches: avoiding, accommodating, compromising, forcing, and collaborating.

Title: Orientace na zákazníka (Senior)
Description:
Introduction: How do I know what my customer wants? And what to do when even he does not know exactly? How to convince and inspire others for my idea? These and other interesting answers can be found in a two-day course focused on the customer orientation. The course focuses at acquiring and practicing skills in order to understand of what is your level of customer orientation and how you can develop it based on your position. The learning methods used will be not only lectures, these will rather play a minor role, but the emphasis is put on practice, hence video making and its analysis. The content and methods of the course for juniors and seniors differ slightly. The difference is in some scenarios and experiences shared by the participants.

Objectives: To  learn how to find out what the customer wants (both internal and external) and also to learn what to do in situations when even he does not know exactly
To find out how to persuade and inspire others for an idea
To broaden knowledge in the area of customer orientation and its application in practice

Target Group: Employees in both in managerial and non-managerial positions who need to gain knowledge and skills in the area of customer orientation. Based on experience, competencies and responsibilities please enroll in the course for juniors or seniors.

Main Topics: caste study - check your abilities related to customer orientation
analysis of customer's needs and understanding of the situation through his/her eyes
get inspired by Steve Jobs and his tips for persuasive presentation of your ideas and solutions
learn how to work with emotions - your own and of the counterparts - during negotiation and how to find a consensus
peer coaching - discuss and get new point of view on situations of your daily work, learn how to use this technique in your team

Duration of the training:   2 days

Language:                                     Czech

Supplier:                                       External training agency Image lab

Costs:  According to the number of participants. These costs will be charged on your department cost center; even when you are not attending the course - based on a late apology (14 days and less before the date of the training).

Title: MCM Module 4 Productrealisatie
Description:
Beschrijving
Deze module geeft inzicht in het traject van productinnovatie tot en met het ontwikkelde product in de winkel presenteren en promoten aan de klant. Tevens wordt stilgestaan bij de rollen van merchandiser en collega’s die tijdens dit proces invloed hebben op kwaliteit en effectiviteit.

Doelstelling
De module kent de volgende doelstellingen. De medewerker:
- kan een productbriefing schrijven die aan alle voorwaarden voor een goede briefing voldoet,
- kan deze briefing helder en duidelijk presenteren,
- kan het KROS-proces binnen de category krachtig en geïnspireerd aansturen, van de prille ideefase tot aan het in de markt zetten,
- kan zijn eigen innovatiekracht ontwikkelen,
kent het belang van kwaliteit voor het retailmerk,
- beschikt over handvatten die de kwaliteitsbeoordeling in de verschillende fases van het KROS-proces helpen te objectiveren.

Inhoud
De inhoud betreft de volgende onderdelen:
- Kennis van de fasen binnen het K.R.O.S. traject.
- Rol van de verschillende afdelingen binnen het innovatieproces (Brand, Formule Management, Design, Kwaliteit, Marktonderzoek, …).
- Eigen rol (taken en verantwoordelijkheden).
- Maken en presenteren van een briefing aan de hand van casuïstiek.

Title: OUT OF SERVICE Ahold Business Control Framework
Description:
This e-learning module presents you with an overview of the Ahold Business Control Framework (“ABC Framework”) and the Ahold Business Control Standards (“ABC Standards”). It also shows you how to access and use these resources.

At the end of this training you will be able to:
•  Explain the ABC Framework and its purpose 
•  Explain the ABC Standards and their purpose 
•  Access and use the ABC Framework Portal 
•  Access and use the ABC Standards Manual 
•  Describe the process for creating ABC

Title: Western Union AMLCP Refresher Training Cash Office Q3
Description: Upon completion of this course, you should be able to: identify daily responsibilities of the Cash Office Lead as they relate to Western Union; identify weekly responsibilities of the Cash Office Lead and Store Manager as they relate to Western Union; and recall how the Cash Office Lead protects customers and the store from potential scams.

Title: Praxe v distribučním centru
Description:
Praxe v distribučním centru (DC) je určena pro všechny nové manažery prodejen v Albert Akademii a stávající zástupce manažerů prodejen, kteří jsou na praxi v distribučním centru nominovaní dle stanovených kritérií.  Praxí nový manažer prodejny v Albert Akademii prochází v průběhu programu Albert Akademie, maximálně však do ukončení tohoto programu. Vybraný zástupce manažera prodejny si projde tuto praxi v průběhu 1 roku od doby nominace, dle dohody s nadřízeným.

Praxe v distribučním centru trvá 1 den a koná se v DC Klecany a Olomouc. 

Program praxe v DC: 

: organizační struktura
: doplnění
: obchod služby
: zboží flow
: čerstvý sklad
: suchý sklad

Na centrálu DC se dostavte v 8:15, kde si vás vyzvedne kompetentní osoba.
 
Prosíme o dochvilnost dle výše zaslaného začátku této praxe. 
 Co s sebou? 
- zdravotní průkaz 
- teplejší oblečení, tmavé kalhoty (ne džíny), pevnou obuv

Introductie hoofdkantoor Ahold Nederland
Description:
De Introductie van Ahold Nederland hoofdkantoor is onderdeel van het introductietraject voor nieuwe medewerkers.

Het introductietraject voor nieuwe medewerkers bestaat uit de volgende onderdelen:
• een introductie op de werkplek
• een introductie van Ahold Nederland hoofdkantoor
• een introductie van de Supply Chain-organisatie en een rondleiding op een distributiecentrum;
• stage in een winkel

Leerdoelen:
De Introductie van Ahold Nederland hoofdkantoor geeft een verdieping van de missie, visie, strategie en organisatie van Ahold Nederland. Daarnaast krijgen de deelnemers tijdens deze introductiedag een kijkje in de keuken van een aantal afdelingen van het hoofdkantoor.

Doelgroep: 
De Introductie van Ahold Nederland hoofdkantoor wordt georganiseerd voor:
• nieuwe medewerkers van de onderdelen van de Ahold Nederland hoofdkantoororganisatie;
• nieuwe Hoger Personeel-medewerkers bij Ahold Nederland;
• Albert Heijn Supermarktmanagers;
• Teamleiders Albert Heijn Distributiecentrum;
• P&O-managers en P&O-adviseurs uit winkel- supply chain en hoofdkantoororganisatie

Van de deelnemers wordt verwacht dat ze basiskennis hebben opgedaan van Ahold Nederland. Dit maakt onderdeel uit van de introductie op de werkplek.

Inhoud van de training:
De Introductie van Ahold Nederland gaat in op de volgende zaken:
• Kennismaking met collega’s
• Missie en strategie van Ahold Nederland
• Klant- en merkstrategie
• Cultuurwaarden
• Organisatie van het hoofdkantoor

Taal:
Nederlands

Uitgevoerd door:
• Directeur, collega’s van hoofdkantoor

Kosten: 
Geen

Tijdsduur: 
De Introductie van Ahold Nederland wordt bij voldoende deelnemers elk kwartaal gegeven en duurt een hele dag.

Inschrijvingsprocedure:
Deelnemers ontvangen circa een maand voor de bijeenkomst via mail een uitnodiging voor bijwonen van deze introductiebijeenkomst.

De aanmelding vindt plaats via het ELM

As a supervisor of employees performing safety-sensitive tasks such as driving it is your responsibility to make sure that they can perform their duties without endangering themselves their fellow employees and the public.

This coursed is geared for supervisors of employees performing safety sensitive tasks such as driving. This supervisor training is required by the Department of Transportation. You will view short instructional segments that cover the information you need to know to keep your employees safe. At the end each segment there will be questions to help you review what you have learned. In the last video segment "Now It's Your Turn" you will be presented with video scenes and asked to apply what you have learned to make the right decisions.

Title: Projektové řízení
Description:
Introduction:

How do I, as a project manager succeeded? How to start, what to remember what is important? What is my responsibility, who can help me? How do I deal with the risks? Answers to these and other questions we will seek together - and find – in a two-day training of project management for future project managers. The course is aimed at acquiring and practicing skills. Participants will work on their own real project during the training, thus they should come with their own assignment / project in mind.

Objectives:

Participants will learn the basic principles and tools of project management
They will practice strategy creation tools and project planning in a case study
And they will get inspiration for their own project management documentation.
Participants will begin to work on their own project preparation with trainer’s and other participants’ support and can verify how advanced are their project management skills.

Target Group:

Managers who are starting to lead challenging projects, where precise planning, considering the risks, searching for and eliminating bottlenecks are necessary.  Also managers who are to lead project teams, or employees in non-managerial positions who run and manage similar projects.Main Topics:

Introduction to Project Management
Establishment of a project (project plan, project benefits, project objective, and three imperaties - what, by when, for how much; project assignment ...)
The organizational structure of the project (the role and responsibilities of the contracting authority / project manager, support teams, subcontractors)
Project strategy (key outputs, activities, inputs, subcontractors, conditions and conditions of realization)
Risk Management
Project plan
Implementation and project closure
Evaluation of the project

Duration of the training:                     2 days

Min-max number of participants:       8 - 15 participants

Language:                                           Czech

Supplier:                                             External training agency Image lab

Location:                                            Ahold location (internal training room)

Overnight Stay:                                   No / Based on standard request

Title: E-learning Soms moet je nee verkopen
Description:
Short introduction: In this e-learning you will learn all you need to know about selling alcohol and tobacco to minors.

For alcohol and tabacco sales the age limit is 18. To ensure that you do not sell alcohol or tobacco to minors you always have to check the identity card (ID) of anyone who looks younger than 25 years. Is the person under the legal age, you are not allowed to sell alcohol or tobacco to him or her. Also, you can not do this if you know that the alcohol or tobacco is going to be shared with someone who does not meet the minimum age. Even if the person you sell the alcohol or tobacco to is of minimum legal age.

The parts 'Mensenkennis' and 'Dubbelcheck' are optional and you can skip this if you know the theory. The exam is mandatory and consists of 20 questions, which you all need to answer correctly to finish the e-learning.

Language: Dutch
Duration: 10 minutes (only exam) or 30 minutes (complete e-learning)

Supplier: Centraal Bureau Levensmiddelen (CBL)

Costs: none

Procedure to enroll: Click on Go to Content to open the Google site. This site is only accessible for persons who have need access to Ahold Google.

Search tags: Alcohol, Tobacco, Law, alcohol sales, legislation, tobacco sales, forbidden, minor, minors, 16 year, 18 year, 25 year.

Title: OUT OF SERVICE Learning Source SOTS Document
Vyjednávání pro pokročilé
Description:
Introduction: Are you frequently negotiating at work with third parties? Do you have a lot of experience, or have you completed the basic course of negotiation ("Art of Negotiation") and you want your knowledge and skills to deepen? Then this interactive training is right for you. Short blocks of presentations are alternated with negotiation situations simulations, negotiating experiments, team work and discussions, video recording followed by a group analysis under the guidance of the experienced trainer.

Objectives: To  consolidate, deepen and develop negotiation skills and knowledge of participants, To provide participants with further negotiation tactics and techniques, To learn participants how to maximize the potential of a possible agreement for all stakeholders

To enable participants to advance their interests in an environment of limited resources and time pressure. Practical experience from the training will allow participants to react properly in a real situation, and will help them quickly select appropriate strategies and tactics
To reveal concepts that push the strategic perspective on negotiation to participants

Target Group: The basic course of negotiation ("Art of Negotiation") graduates, or employees who already have extensive practical experience in negotiating, and who need to acquire knowledge and enhance skills in advanced negotiation techniques; the training is not primarily intended for commercial positions (Category Managers, Merchandising Assistants, etc.).

Main Topics: Revision of the main principles of negotiation
Team discussion of experience with the application of the negotiation skills in practice, Recent findings of neuroscience in the services of negotiations
Advanced persuasion, Managing the dynamics of team negotiations
Other tactics of positional negotiation and effective defense
Interests in cooperative negotiations, Usage of objective criteria in cooperative negotiations, How to separate better "the people from the problem" in a cooperative negotiation, What can we learn from the history and current practice of diplomatic negotiations to apply it in our practice

Supplier: External training agency Interquality

Costs:  According to the number of participants. These costs will be charged on your department cost center; even when you are not attending the course - based on a late apology (14 days and less before the date of the training).

Keywords: negotiation, negotiation skills, impact and influence, BATNA, efficient persuading, positional negotiation, cooperative negotiation, win-win strategy, win-win

Title: Personal Development Program (PDP)
Description:
Introduction: In this 2 day course you will get acquainted with effective forms of communication and you will be able to start using them in practice. You will also get to know your strengths and weaknesses in communication and improve your ability to work with them.  The aim is also to acquire skills for understanding different personality types of people, understand the principles of teamwork and to learn how to prevent and resolve conflict situations. The course is interactive (personality diagnostics, role plays, etc).

Objectives: To become familiar with effective forms of communication and be able to use them in practice, To be able to work with own strengths and weaknesses in communication, To gain knowledge to understand the different personality types of people, To understand the principles of teamwork
To learn how to prevent and resolve conflict situations

Target group: Employees in non-managerial positions with the need of self-reflection; dealing with weaknesses and strengths and also need to learn to recognize other colleagues and efficiently cooperate and work with them.

Main Topics: Personality typology (according to Kolb, Honey, Mumford)
Effective verbal communication, Teamwork (Belbin typology), Nonverbal Communication, Unpleasant and conflict situations, Personal authority at work
Action plan – way to improve (Personal card PDP)

Duration of the training:                     2 days

Min-max number of participants:       8 - 12 participants

Language:                                           Czech

Supplier:                                             External training agency MC Triton

Location:                                            Ahold location (internal training room)

Overnight Stay:                                   No / Based on standard request

Costs:  According to the number of participants. These costs will be charged on your department cost center; even when you are not attending the course - based on a late apology (14 days and less before the date of the training).

Keywords: Communication, Strengths and Weaknesses, Personality Typology, Personality Types, Teamwork, conflict Situations, Personal Authority, Belbin Typology

Title: Coachend leiderschap
Description:
In deze training worden de volgende onderdelen behandelt:
• Basis competentiegericht coachingsmodel. 
• Leidinggeven en coachen, hoe om te gaan met de spanning tussen leidinggeven en ontwikkelen. 
• Welke competenties heeft een coach nodig? 
• Hoe kun je werken met competenties en competentieprofielen? 
• Effectieve vraagtechnieken voor coaches. 
• Opstellen van een coachingscontract en hoe daarnaar te handelen.
• Diagnose van de verbeterpunten en de achtergronden, met behulp van een acteur aan de hand van voorbeeldcases. 
• Oefenen met coachcompetenties luisteren en sensitiviteit en het creëren van een veilige situatie. 
• Verbeterinterventies uitvoeren en de zelfwerkzaamheid van de gecoachte bevorderen. 
• Oefenen met eigen praktijkcases met behulp van trainingsacteur. 
• Praktijkopdracht
• Herkennen van en omgaan met verschillende vormen van weerstand met behulp van de trainingsacteur. 
• Motiveren van de gecoachte bij uitblijvende resultaten. 
• Borgen van bereikte verbeteringen in de HR systemen van de organisatie. 
• Vertalen van de nieuwe inzichten en aanpak naar de eigen praktijk van de deelnemer. 

Doelgroep:
Lijn- en stafmanagers, hoofden en middelmanagers met ten minste twee jaar leidinggevende ervaring.. 

U kunt uw medewerkers effectief en constructief coachen, zodat de benodigde competenties ontwikkeld worden die nodig zijn om het beoogde resultaat te realiseren.
• U beschikt over een resultaatgerichte aanpak die een beperkte tijdsinvestering vraagt. 
• U heeft een competentiegerichte aanpak ontwikkeld. 
• U bent gegroeid in uw rol als coach. 
• U benut de talenten van uw medewerkers maximaal. 
• U kunt heldere coachingscontracten opstellen. 
• U overwint weerstanden en belemmeringen.

Kosten: € 1825,-

Deze training wordt gegeven door Boertien

Voor meer info: http://www.boertiengroep.nl/nederlands/training/trainingen/BCOLG/coachend-leidinggeven.html

Title: Coachend Leidinggeven
Description:
Onderwerpen van de training:
-  het vaststellen van uw stijl van leidinggeven
-  het begrip coachen
-  het belang van continu leren en ontwikkelen
-  vaardigheden en attitude van de coachende leidinggevende
-  coaching binnen organisaties, op teamniveau en individuele coaching
-  inbedding coachingsgesprekken: coachen op competenties vanuit een POP (Persoonlijk 
   Ontwikkel Plan)
-  omgaan met verantwoordelijkheid
-  weerstand/motivatie.

Doelgroep:
Managers en projectleiders met minimaal één jaar leidinggevende ervaring. 

Na de training:
-  bent u in staat om uw stijl van leidinggeven aan te passen aan hetgeen de medewerker
   nodig heeft om tot optimale resultaten te komen
-  bent u in staat om coachende gesprekken met uw medewerkers te voeren en weet u deze  
   gesprekken te plaatsen binnen het geheel van leidinggevende taken
-  hebt u inzicht in uw kwaliteiten en ontwikkelpunten als coachend leidinggevende.

Kosten: € 1850,-

Deze training wordt gegeven door Bureau Zuidema.

Voor meer info: http://www.zuidema.nl/nl/25/trainingsaanbod---open-inschrijving/training/45/coachend-leiderschap

Title: Conflict hanteren
Description:
Pogramma:
• Wat is een conflict? Analyse van uw eigen conflictsituatie aan de hand van de volgende stappen: 
- conflictbronnen
- escalatiemechanismen
- conflictstijlen
• Oefenen met deelvaardigheid: Exploreren 
• Oefening: “Ruzie maken!” 
• Analyse eigen case
• Oefenen met deelvaardigheid: Omgaan met emoties van de ander 
• Oefenen met deelvaardigheid: Omgaan met eigen emoties 
• Fases van Constructief Conflicthanteren: kritiek geven en ontvangen 
• Interactie in conflicten - de Roos van Leary 
• Verdere uitwerking Constructief Conflicthanteren 
• Total Skill: oefenen van eigen conflictsituatie met acteur

Doelgroep:
Wanneer u conflicten op een constructievere manier wilt kunnen oplossen of wanneer u in uw werk direct betrokken bent bij tegenstellingen en conflictsituaties

Doelen:
Na deze training: 
• kent u de voor- en nadelen van uw eigen stijl van conflicthanteren 
• kunt u ook andere stijlen inzetten 
• weet u op welke manieren een conflict ontstaat 
• kunt u de juiste oplossingsstrategie bij elk type conflict inzetten 
• kunt u in uw eigen conflictsituatie beter omgaan met uw eigen emoties en met de emoties van de ander

Kosten: € 2095,-

Deze training wordt verzorgd door Boertien.

Meer info: http://www.boertiengroep.nl/nederlands/training/trainingen/BCFHT/conflicthanteren.html

Title: Creatief denken
Description:
Door veel praktische oefeningen te doen raakt u vertrouwd met diverse creatieve denktechnieken. Het accent ligt op het begeleiden van denksessies van uw eigen team. De fase van het krijgen van frisse, creatieve ideeën het hoofdthema. U oefent met het overdragen van technieken en experimenteert met regietechnische en groepsdynamische aspecten die van belang zijn voor een geslaagde groepsbijeenkomst. Uw eigen praktijksituatie dient daarbij als uitgangspunt. Naast praktijkgerichte oefeningen zijn er korte theoretische intermezzo's.

Doelgroep:
U bent manager, projectleider, coach of adviseur en u wilt de innovatieve denkkracht van uzelf en anderen verdiepen en aanscherpen. Bij het zoeken naar originele ideeën en oplossingen wilt u nieuwe, creatieve denktechnieken leren gebruiken. U wilt innovatieve groepsbijeenkomsten adequaat en stimulerend kunnen begeleiden.

Doelen:
U hebt inzicht in creatieve denkprocessen. U beheerst de vaardigheden die nodig zijn om creatief en innovatief te denken. U stelt het geven van een oordeel uit en u bent goed in associëren en verbeelden. U bent in staat zelf vernieuwende invalshoeken op te sporen. Ook stimuleert u creatief en patroondoorbrekend denken.

Kosten: € 1895,-

Deze training wordt verzorgd door Schouten & Nelissen

Meer info: http://www.sn.nl/sn/creatief-denken-vergroten-van-innovatiekracht/

Title: Creativiteit en resultaat
Description:
Programma:
• 4-stappenmodel voor het aanboren en benutten van creativiteit 
• Kijken en doorvragen vanuit verrassende invalshoeken 
• Formuleren van inspirerende vraagstukken 
• Genereren van ideeën 
• Ideëen omzetten in oplossingen 
• Het kiezen voor een oplossing 
• Zelf creatief blijven

Doelgroep:
Iedereen die creativiteit als een oplossing ziet om zijn dagelijkse werkzaamheden anders aan te pakken. Iedereen die creativiteit nodig heeft om zijn werk goed te doen. U wilt praktische problemen op een creatieve manier aanpakken en bent op zoek naar vernieuwende oplossingen.

Doelen:
• bent u vertrouwd met het 4-fasenmodel van creativiteit en de procon-methode voor ideeënselectie; 
• zult u theoretische creativiteitsmodellen in uw dagelijkse praktijk integreren; 
• heeft u handvatten voor het produceren van ideeën op die momenten, dat deze vereist zijn.

Kosten: € 1195,-

De training wordt verzorgd door Boertien.

Meer info: http://www.boertiengroep.nl/nederlands/training/trainingen/BCRER/creativiteit-en-resultaat.html

It's fun to work in the Deli, interact with our customers and give them the best shopping experience they've ever had!

Title: Introduction to Slicers and Slicing
Description:
Did you know that the world's first slicer was invented in 1898 in Rotterdam by a butcher named Wilhelm Van Berkel?

And that's just the first cut when it comes to deli slicers and slicing deli meats and cheeses. You will also learn who can and can't operate a slicer, the different parts of a slicer and how to use and clean it. You will also see how to sharpen and maintain a slicer safely and efficiently.

Title: Satisfying DEA Standards When Dispensing Controlled Substances
Description:
To support your compliance and your ability to satisfy the pharmacist's responsibilities, this program will prepare you to: 


	Describe your oblications as a pharamcist regarding the dispensing of controlled substances
	Explain the DEA's "corresponding responsibility" rule and expectations of pharamacists

	Explain appropriate actions that can resolve red flags

Title: De effectieve adviseur
Description:
Programma:

• Wat is adviseren? 
• Uzelf als verkoopmiddel van uw advies 
• Vier fases in het adviesproces 
• Leggen van contact en maken van contract 
• De vraag in kaart brengen en de vraag achter de vraag 
• Adviesrollen 
• Afhankelijk van het door u gekozen arrangement, vindt aansluitend het diner plaats
• Adviesgame "Berg en Plas". U doorloopt het gehele adviesproces en spreekt drie verschillende opdrachtgevers. Op basis van deze gesprekken met de opdrachtgevers ontwerpt u een advies en presenteert u dit aan hen. U wordt uitgedaagd al uw adviesvaardigheden in te zetten om tot een succesvol advies te komen! 
• De 3 opdrachtgevers bespreken alle 'adviesbureaus; daarna komen ze, weer als gewone mensen, langs om u persoonlijk feedback te geven
• Presentatie van het advies 
•Het omgaan met weerstanden en het verwerven van acceptatie 
• Maatwerk op basis van individuele en groepsbehoeften

Doelgroep:
Adviseurs van financiële instellingen zoals banken, verzekeraars; consultants, HRM consultants, beleidsmedewerkers van ministeries, P&O adviseurs, accountmanagers. U adviseert vanuit uw eigen vakgebied en vanuit een niet-hiërarchische positie interne en/of externe opdrachtgevers.

Doelen:
Door een positieve en transparante opstelling legt u eenvoudiger contacten en verwerft u meer draagvlak voor uw ideeën. Uw invloed op de omgeving neemt toe en u weet adviesprocessen beter te sturen.
• U kunt het gehele adviesproces sturen en beïnvloeden. 
• U kunt goed omgaan met rolverwachtingen en conflicten. 
• U bent bekend met uw eigen stijl van adviseren. 
• U kunt verschillende adviestechnieken toepassen; uw adviezen worden zo sneller geaccepteerd.

Kosten: € 1995,-

Deze training wordt verzorgd door Boertien.

Meer info: http://www.boertiengroep.nl/nederlands/training/trainingen/BEFAD/de-effectieve-adviseur.html

Title: Teamavond 100% ID Alcohol en Tabak
Description:
"Korte introductie: De teamavond alcohol wordt in de winkel georganiseerd door Teamleider evt ondersteund door (A)SM. Voor het organiseren, voorbereiden en geven van de teamavond wordt gebruik gemaakt van de Handleiding en Fotosheet (zie hieronder bij ""verwante documenten"").
Het fotosheet is in kleur op te vragen via de bestellijst opleidingsmaterialen op Plaza.

Leerdoelen 
Deelnemers:
- Kennen de wetgeving rondom verkoop van Alcohol en tabak door jongeren tot en met 18 jaar
- Kennen de richtlijnen rondom legitimatieplicht bij aankoop van Alcohol en tabak door jongeren tot en met 25 jaar
- Zijn zich bewust van de positieve en negatieve ervaringen van caissières bij het vragen naar ID aan jongeren
- Weten welke oplossingen andere caissières hier zelf voor hanteren
- Zijn op de hoogte van de ondersteunende rol die het kader (teamleiders en (Assistent) Supermarktmanager) hierbij moeten hebben.

Uitgangspunten:
- De winkel scoort nog geen 100% bij een controle door een derde partij (bijv. audit) bij het vragen naar legitimatie aan de kassa
- Na observatie door de Teamleider/(Assistent) Supermarktmanager is gebleken dat caissières niet naar ID vragen of dat zij de procedure omtrent kassablokkade niet correct opvolgen
- Caissières zijn allen bekend met de wetgeving en het beleid van Albert Heijn rondom legitimatieplicht door de caissière (A en/of B) opleiding die zij gevolgd hebben.

Aanmeldingsprocedure: De winkel organiseert zelf lokaal een teamavond. 

Trefwoorden: alcohol tabak teamavond soms moet je nee verkopen smjnv wetgeving drank sigaretten nix18 100% ID 100%id"

Title: Corrective Action
Description:
Progressive discipline is a great way to enforce company policies and maintain a productive workforce. if your supervisors do it right. Done improperly or inconsistently it opens a legal trapdoor. Danger Zones: Discipline walks your supervisors through a sample 3 step disciplinary process and shows them how to make it work. They learn how to earn respect for themselves and your organization through professionalism of language and action. And they learn how to deal with problem employees quickly and with the least disruption. 
Plus, they learn key points about fundamental rights and responsibilities that come with the authority they earned though promotion to management. And they get insights into the skills required to safely demote, suspend, and fire any member of the workforce.

Title: Teamcoaching
Description:
Deze training is bedoeld voor HR Business partners om te professionaliseren richting change agent. Het concrete resultaat van de training is dat HR-professionals zelfstandig teams kunnen begeleiden in hun ontwikkeling, zonder hulp van externe consultants. 

De training bestaat uit drie dagen verdeeld over verschillende weken, waarin geoefend kan worden met het geleerde in de praktijk.

De leerdoelen van de training zijn:
- vaardigheden op gebied van coachen van teams op een ‘hoger plan’ brengen.
- inzicht in de fases van teamontwikkeling en weten hoe te handelen in de verschillende fases.
- kennen van de rol van conflicten bij de ontwikkeling van teams.
- weten welke interventies/ werkvormen ingezet kunnen worden om een team te helpen in hun ontwikkeling.
- durven te interveniëren op procesniveau en het benoemen van de (onderliggende) emoties. 
- weten welke invloed als implementatiecoach/ teamcoach er zijn op de teamontwikkeling/organisatieverandering.
- onderzoeken wat persoonlijk lastige momenten zijn in het werken met groepen en vergroten van interventievaardigheden in dergelijke situaties.
- leren Intervisie methode toe te passen en actief te gebruiken binnen het team.

Op de eerste dag ligt de nadruk op de fases van team-ontwikkeling en mogelijke interventievormen. Doel is dat de teamcoach op basis van zijn analyse zelfstandig een programma kan maken. Wat is je diagnose en welke interventie ga je inzetten, met welk doel en met welk effect? 

Deelnemers krijgen na dag 1 de opdracht in duo’s een (eigen) situatie voor te bereiden (maximaal 20 minuten) gebaseerd op hun eigen praktijk, waarmee ze experimenteren op dag 2.

Op de tweede dag ligt de nadruk op de begeleidingsvaardigheden.

Op de derde dag ligt de nadruk op het delen van ervaringen met behulp van de intervisie methode. Deze methodiek kunnen de deelnemers ook na de teamcoaching structureel inzetten om de opgedane kennis en ervaring op een constructieve manier te blijven delen.

Title: Ahold Competency Awareness VP
Description:
30 minutes

Introduction of Ahold Values and Competencies for Ahold Executives.

Our strategy tells us where we are going, our core values tell us what we stand for, and our core capabilities tell us what we need to be good at to make a difference. Our strategy, core values, and core capabilities are crucially interdependent and drive our actions, decisions and communication with each other and our customers. To ensure that we act accordingly, we have developed a set of competencies that describe the behaviors we need in our organization.

A competency is a personal quality, visible and measurable in behavior, which is a qualifi cation for excellent performance. Competencies tell us what behavior supports realizing our strategy and living according to our core values.

Title: Discrimination
Description:
Danger Zone: Discrimination makes your supervisors fully aware of the "protected classes"-the 6 specific factors they must never consider when making a decision. It explains how to apply The American with Disabilities Act when assigning tasks. Show them how to respect religious differences.
More than ever, your supervisors are the first line of defense against discrimination lawsuits. Give them the clear, up-to-date information they need to avoid legal hazards and keep your company on solid legal footing.
The Family & Medical Leave Act remains one of the most complicated laws for supervisors and HR professionals, who both play a critical role in explaining it to employees and identifying absences covered by it. This video identifies the 4 basic FMLA "triggers". Plus, supervisors learn how to recognize a serious health condition and how to avoid any action or statement that could be construed as retaliation for taking FMLA leave.

Title: Communicatievaardigheden voor IT consultants
Description:
Deze training is bedoeld om beter te communiceren in algemene zin. Dit moet leiden tot een meer pro-actieve én effectieve sturing in klantgesprekken.

In deze training wordt communicatietheorie afgewisseld met praktijkoefeningen. Deze oefeningen moeten voor een deel de bewustwording van het eigen communicatiegedrag teweeg brengen en voor een ander deel de communicatieve vaardigheden trainen. De oefeningen worden meteen in een gesprekssituatie geplaatst die de deelnemers in hun praktijk tegenkomen.
 
Tussen de trainingsdagen door kunnen de deelnemers het geleerde direct in de praktijk toepassen. De opgedane ervaring bespreken we daarna weer met elkaar en verwerken deze in een persoonlijk actieplan. De training is gebaseerd op de praktijk van de deelnemers en verbonden aan de praktijk van Albert Heijn.

De deelnemer is zich na afloop van de training bewust van zijn eigen communicatiestijl en in gesprekken met interne klanten en collega’s weet hij:
1. effectief feedback te geven en te ontvangen;
2. een doel vast te houden en regie te houden in een gesprek;
3. te schakelen naar verschillende niveaus in een gesprek;
4. om te gaan met bezwaren door middel van het BADSOC-model;
5. bewust om te gaan met zijn non-verbale communicatie.

De deelnemer kan na afloop van de training de volgende vaardigheden effectief toepassen in de praktijk:
- Actief luisteren.
- Vragen stellen en doorvragen.
- Samenvatten.
- Matchen.
- Feedback geven en ontvangen.
- Omgaan met weerstand en bezwaren.
- Beïnvloeden in een gesprek.
- Pro-actief (interne) klantgesprekken voeren.


Training-agency: 
Deze training wordt gegeven door Boertien groep.

Duration: 
De training bestaat uit twee losse dagen met één à twee weken tussen dag 1 en dag 2. Op deze manier kunnen de deelnemers het geleerde in de praktijk actief toepassen en de opgedane ervaringen gebruiken als input voor de tweede dag.

Title: Leergang Regie
Description:
De Leergang Regie is een 5-daagse training waarin de deelnemers inzicht krijgen in het hoe en waarom van een regieorganisatie, wordt ingegaan op de implementatiekeuze van regie, rollen en competenties in een regieorganisatie en de regieorganisatie in verhouding tot zijn omgeving. Integraal onderdeel van deze leergang is de simulatie waarin deelnemers de ruimte wordt geboden om te experimenteren met de gevolgen van houding, gedrag en (strategische) keuzes.

Het runnen van een effectieve en efficiënte IT organisatie vraagt om afstemming tussen de Business en de IT Service Providers. Het implementeren van processen blijkt, in de praktijk, niet voldoende om dit te realiseren. Wat nodig is, is een regie organisatie die werknemers in staat stelt om de koppelvlakken
tussen Demand, Supply en de interne IT organisatie effectief te benaderen. Gebaseerd op jaren praktijk ervaring en interne expertise
heeft Quint het DSG Framework ontwikkeld. De theorie is uitgebreid met een vaardighedenpakket waarin de persoonlijke benadering van de rol binnen de regie organisatie centraal staat.
Regie is het mechanisme dat zorg draagt dat juiste IT (investerings) beslissingen genomen worden, op de juiste manier, door de juiste
mensen en dat deze beslissingen ook gecontroleerd worden. Het implementeren van een regie organisatie is meer dan het simpelweg implementeren van een
model, maar gaat om het veranderen van menselijke vaardigheden, houding en gedrag.

Doelstelling
- Het begrijpen van de werking van de regie organisatie, de koppelvlakken binnen de regie
organisatie en de toegevoegde waarde voor de IT organisatie.
- De rollen in de regie organisatie en de koppelvlakken tussen de verschillende rollen.
- Inzicht krijgen in het implementeren en de uitdagingen hiervan

Training-agency: De training wordt verzorgd door Quint Wellington Redwood

Title: Workshop Zelfzorgadvisering
Description:
"Korte introductie:
Sinds de invoering van de Geneesmiddelenwet in juli 2007 geldt in elke winkel een adviesplicht. Wat dat inhoudt? Eigenlijk heel simpel: je zorgt dat iedere klant die daar behoefte aan heeft de deur uit gaat met een deskundig advies.

Maar wat is een goed advies? Waar moet je op letten en waar loop je in de praktijk tegenaan? Na het volgen van de interactieve workshop Zelfzorgadvisering ben je weer helemaal up-to-date. Een professionele trainer met kennis van de praktijk neemt je mee in verschillende praktijkcases in een echte winkelsetting. Zij bespreekt de do’s en de dont’s bij advisering, legt uit hoe het ook alweer zit met de kassacheck en de WASA-vragen, laat adviessituaties zien en daagt jou uit om ook zelf je kennis en adviesvaardigheden in de praktijk te brengen.

Kom je net kijken of zit je al jaren in het vak; deze workshop is een absolute aanrader voor iedereen die deskundig voor de dag wil komen. Niet alleen leerzaam maar vooral erg leuk en direct toepasbaar op de werkvloer!

Benodigde voorkennis: geen, de workshop is geschikt voor het hele winkelteam.

Taal: Nederlands

Leverancier: Koert de Ruijter, CBD

Locatie: In de winkel

Overnachting: Nee

Kosten: € 150,-- per groep. Deze kosten worden doorbelast op het kostenplaatsnummer van de winkel.

Min-max groepsomvang: .. deelnemers - .. deelnemers

Aanmeldingsprocedure: deze workshop kan via de HR business partner en Operationeel manager aangevraagd worden. (dmv een groepsaanvraag)

Trefwoorden: zelfzorgadvies, geneesmiddelen, kassacheck, drogisterij, certificering, WASA, "

Title: Prince2 Foundation
Description:
In PRINCE2 Foundation Blended, employees with some elementary knowledge and experience in project leadership learn and practice the PRINCE2-methodology on the basis of actual real life examples, and the PRINCE2-principles, themes en processes. 

During the course much attention will be given to the Why of the method and – consequently – the application of the various components. After completion of the course the participant will be familiar with the terminology of PRINCE2 and will know why PRINCE2 adheres to:
- well-defined tasks and responsibilities of project manager and project board;
- a well-established business case to account for the project;
- „steering‟ of the project with phases and tolerances;
- the use of product descriptions for drawing up plans;
- keeping up risks, issues and quality;
- change control.

The training course is a mix of class room (1 day) and e-learning. 

After completion of the course, the participants take the APMG examination PRINCE2 Foundation. 

Method: 
Instructor lead classroom training, in combination with e-learning and formal exam.

Language: 
Dutch or English

Training-agency: 
This training is given by Capgemini Academy

Type of training: 
In-company

Duration: 
1,5 day plus time for following e-learning and preparation of exam questions

Min-Max groupsize: 
8 - 15

Procedure to enroll: 
This training is organized by request for groups only.

Title: Objednávkové nástroje Super Fresh pro hypermarkety
Vakdiploma Drogist
Description:
Het diploma Drogist heeft een wettelijke status. In de Wet op de Geneesmiddelenvoorziening (WOG) is vastgelegd dat de drogist de bevoegdheid heeft om niet-receptgeneesmiddelen af te leveren.

Het Vakdiploma Drogist vormt de basis voor de, door het ministerie van Volksgezondheid, Welzijn en Sport (VWS) verstrekte, geneesmiddelenvergunning en dus de bevoegdheid om zelfzorggeneesmiddelen te mogen verkopen.

Het niveau van deze opleiding is vergelijkbaar met MBO niveau 4, maar het is geen volledige MBO-opleiding (diploma geeft dus ook geen toegang tot een HBO-opleiding).

De opleiding tot drogist is opgesplitst in drie delen: Drogist en Zelfzorg 1, 2 & 3. De delen zijn zo opgebouwd dat het niet noodzakelijk is om ze in een bepaalde volgorde te doorlopen. De aankomend drogist bepaalt zelf met welke deel wordt gestart.

Franklin Covey "Focus"
Description:
Based on the book, “Seven Habits of Highly Effective People” by Stephen Covey, this workshop concentrates on managing work and personal time to achieve what matters most in life.  All participants will receive and learn to use a Franklin day planner as part of this course.
Topics include:
The role of planning in the control process
Developing a personal mission statement
Understanding those governing values that define what matters most in your life

Title: The Fundamentals of Effective Thinking
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval.  To start the process, press the "Add to Learning Plan" button, then press the "Request Approval," button, and finally press the "Submit" button. If there are any questions, a training department representative will contact you.  An e-mail communication will be sent to you when the course has been approved.

CourseDescription=Albert Einstein once remarked that "the significant problems we face cannot be solved at the same level of thinking we were at when we created them." It necessarily follows that you must raise your own level of thinking in order to solve pressing business problems and make effective decisions. In this course, you'll explore how to think about the most critical business skill of all--thinking itself. You'll first learn about the counterproductive thinking patterns and tendencies most people naturally fall prey to. You'll then discover how these largely intuitive tendencies manifest themselves in problem-solving mind-sets and decision-making styles. Finally, you'll take the necessary steps to neutralize ineffective thinking habits and instead practice dynamic and results-oriented thinking strategies. The result? You'll become a better thinker, someone who can apply these new-found techniques to achieve organizational goals within the current climate of great institutional change.
TargetAudience=Executives, managers, supervisors, team leaders, and other business professionals who want to enhance their ability to solve business problems and make effective personal and organizational decisions
Duration = 3.0 hours

Title: Effective Interfunctional Relationships
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval.  To start the process, press the "Add to Learning Plan" button, then press the "Request Approval," button, and finally press the "Submit" button. If there are any questions, a training department representative will contact you.  An e-mail communication will be sent to you when the course has been approved.

CourseDescription=Whom did you talk with at work this week? To accomplish your goals in today's workplace, you not only have to interact with personnel in other departments, you often have to coordinate or even rely on them. Tasks are fluid and flow across functional boundaries. The products or services your company offers require a cooperative effort to produce. But by nature, most companies are structured territorially. Every department head and manager has his or her own troops on call and a personal domain to defend. Protecting your turf may be instinctual, but it's also counterproductive. By not cooperating openly with other sections or departments, you not only interfere with their ability to accomplish their tasks, you undermine your own efforts as well. In this course you'll discover how you may be inadvertently sabotaging yourself when you let your territorial instincts guide your interactions. Once you understand how interfunctional relationships benefit you and your work goals, you'll be ready to learn some communication skills that will help you develop stronger, more productive work alliances across functional boundaries.
TargetAudience=Department heads, supervisors, managers
Duration = 2.5 hours

Title: Your Time and You
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval.  To start the process, press the "Add to Learning Plan" button, then press the "Request Approval," button, and finally press the "Submit" button. If there are any questions, a training department representative will contact you.  An e-mail communication will be sent to you when the course has been approved.

CourseDescription=Before you can decide how to manage your time better, you need to recognize how you manage your time now. 

Busy people do what is required, and rarely have the opportunity to stop and consider whether they are making the best use of their time. A brief analysis of what you do currently may surprise you, and it may help you to identify some changes that could be made.

This course will help you to consider the activities that currently take up most of your time, and how you plan and log them. You will also be encouraged to consider the work-life balance to which you aspire, and what steps you could take to make this wish a reality.

Each of us is different, and this inevitably affects the way in which we approach time management. Some people habitually wake early, and find that the morning is the best time for them to handle creative tasks or difficult problems; others prefer to rise and work late--these people probably prefer to tackle only easy, routine tasks in the morning.  Our personalities also play a significant role in the way we handle tasks and manage time.

You are probably already doing certain things well, but there will inevitably be areas that can be improved. The last lesson in this course will help you to approach these changes in a positive and constructive way.
TargetAudience=Anyone in business who would like to have more time to do things that they really need or want to do
Duration=3.0 hours

Title: Leading an Effective Business Meeting
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval.  To start the process, press the "Add to Learning Plan" button, then press the "Request Approval," button, and finally press the "Submit" button. If there are any questions, a training department representative will contact you.  An e-mail communication will be sent to you when the course has been approved.

CourseDescription=Since there are more than 11 million meetings held every day in the United States, there is a good chance that your life is full of meetings. There is a general agreement among business professionals that most meetings are not well run. They often waste your time, drain your energy, seem to have no purpose, and bear few positive results. Are you tired of attending meetings like this? Are you tired of your meetings ending up like this? This course will teach you how to make your meetings more successful by providing the tools and information that are necessary to lead an effective meeting.
TargetAudience=Business professionals who want to develop effective facilitation skills, members of boards or committees, meeting participants, executive assistants, and individuals who want to prepare themselves for a business environment.
Duration=2.5 hours

Title: Participating Effectively in a Business Meeting
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval.  To start the process, press the "Add to Learning Plan" button, then press the "Request Approval," button, and finally press the "Submit" button. If there are any questions, a training department representative will contact you.  An e-mail communication will be sent to you when the course has been approved.

CourseDescription=A meeting is a gathering of people to present or exchange information, plan joint activities, make decisions, or carry out actions already agreed upon. Almost every group activity or project requires a meeting, or meetings, of some sort. Knowing how to hold efficient and effective meetings can help make projects successful. In a good meeting, participants' ideas are heard, decisions are made through group discussion and with reasonable speed, and activities are focused on desired results. Good meetings help generate enthusiasm for a project, build skills for future projects, and provide participants with techniques that may benefit them in their future careers. As a chairperson, a secretary, or a group member, it is crucial to your meeting's success to know what your role is during a meeting. By knowing your duties, you can effectively assume one of these roles and help to attain success during your meetings.
TargetAudience=Business professionals who want to develop effective facilitation skills, members of boards or committees, meeting participants, executive assistants, and individuals who want to prepare themselves for a business environment.
Duration=2.5 hours

Title: Generating Creative and Innovative Ideas
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval.  To start the process, press the "Add to Learning Plan" button, then press the "Request Approval," button, and finally press the "Submit" button. If there are any questions, a training department representative will contact you.  An e-mail communication will be sent to you when the course has been approved.

CourseDescription=Is creativity within everyone's grasp? Are people innately creative, or is this a skill that some learn, and others don't?
If you have ever watched children at play, it's easy to conclude that all people start at the same level, with the same creative ability. Perhaps they lose their "creative toolboxes" with the self-consciousness of adolescence, or as other demands compete for attention.

Whatever the reason, it's important that you regain your ability to be creative and innovative. More and more organizations are turning to in-house human resources as a rich source of ideas in the knowledge economy. Indeed, the well-known mantra: "People are our greatest asset" has never been so accurate.

This course is designed to help you to boost your creative toolbox. You will look at team methods of fostering creativity and innovation in the workplace, such as brainstorming and the Nominal Group Technique. Then you will explore techniques that can be used individually for personal inspiration, including the importance of conflict, and how nature and history can help you in your quest for greater creativity. Finally, you will also consider the importance of "keeping grounded" and of building on ideas.
Duration = 3.5 hours

Title: Effective Relationships with Customers
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval.  To start the process, press the "Add to Learning Plan" button, then press the "Request Approval," button, and finally press the "Submit" button. If there are any questions, a training department representative will contact you.  An e-mail communication will be sent to you when the course has been approved.

CourseDescription=It's time to disregard that old deferential model of short-term customer relations you're using. Why not replace it with a selection of long-term relational skills that work for you in the marketplace? Take control by picking the best customers and developing equal, trusting partnerships with them. When you limit your investment in your customer relationships, you also limit your growth potential. Developing strong, respectful relationships with your customers is a win-win situation. This course introduces the ingredients for creating and maintaining more effective and productive relationships with your customers and explains why these elements can generate better outcomes than earlier customer paradigms. The most effective relationships are mutually supportive and mutually beneficial. And they last beyond next quarter's returns. Investing in the relationship and creating value for your customers rewards your business as well.
TargetAudience=Anyone in an organization responsible for marketing strategies or customer relationships.
Duration = 2.0 hours

Title: Trends in Coaching
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval.  To start the process, press the "Add to Learning Plan" button, then press the "Request Approval," button, and finally press the "Submit" button. If there are any questions, a training department representative will contact you.  An e-mail communication will be sent to you when the course has been approved.

CourseDescription=When is a good time to coach? And what is the business case for coaching? Is coaching just another popular fad, or can organizations really benefit from it?
Every coach should be aware of the strategic uses of coaching: the organizational benefits that are offered, how coaching can be used to help coachees deal with positive and negative change, and ways of coaching innovators and mavericks.
What factors are important when coaching teams? It's true that many of the techniques that you use for individual coaching will be the same. But when coaching teams, you'll need to run an initial meeting, set boundaries, and deal with team tension.
In order for coaching to improve the bottom line for your organization, you must display an ongoing commitment to coaching. Coaching works in all directions--consider upward and peer-to-peer coaching--which is one of the reasons it is so powerful. Total confidentiality and life coaching can also help to foster a long-term coaching strategy that leads to ultimate business success.
TargetAudience=This course is designed for anyone in an organization who has a role in improving the performance of co-workers, keeping in mind the fact that coaching is not a top-down activity. The target audience includes not only team members, team leaders, and supervisors, but also managers and CEOs.
Duration=2.5 hours

Title: WORD LEVEL 1
Description:
In this course, students will learn the basic skills necessary to begin using Word 2003. Students will learn how to create and edit documents and use 
character and paragraph formatting. 
Upon successful completion of this course, students will be able to:
Create and save a document; open an existing document; and use simple editing techniques
Navigate in a large document by using the mouse and keyboard
Edit a document by using more sophisticated techniques, including 
moving and copying text within a document and between documents
Apply and remove character and paragraph formatting
Use tabs and create and modify a table structure
Adjust margins, add and delete page breaks, and create headers and footers
Use Word's proofing tools such as the spell checker and thesaurus

Title: Optimizing E-mail at Work
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval. CourseDescription=In today's business world, e-mail is used to do everything from processing orders to supplying information. Because of the limitations of telephone communication when people who are very busy or sometimes in different time zones work together, e-mail use is on the rise in U.S. E-mail offers a plenitude of new opportunities for business, but understanding how to properly use it is essential in order to take advantage of these opportunities. This course will tell you what makes e-mail unique and provide you with the skills to write, send, and receive business e-mail effectively. You will learn how to best use the features that are commonly included in e-mail programs in a way that improves your communicative ability and efficiency at work.
Duration=2.0 hours

Title: Managing and Rewarding Top Performers
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval.  To start the process, press the "Add to Learning Plan" button, then press the "Request Approval," button, and finally press the "Submit" button. If there are any questions, a training department representative will contact you.  An e-mail communication will be sent to you when the course has been approved.

CourseDescription=Does your company have a policy in place for hiring and retaining its top-performing employees? Would you know how to convince valuable employees to stay if they were to hand in their resignation? It is becoming increasingly difficult for companies to retain their top-level employees in today's competitive market. This course examines how to attract and ultimately retain top performers through a combination of benefits packages, performance reviews, improved management policies and other non-financial reward strategies. You will also learn how to promote your company in such a way as to increase interest among prospective candidates and further improve loyalty from top performers within your organization.
TargetAudience=Managers, supervisors and HR professionals; anyone who is responsible for managing employees or devising employee policy
Duration=2.5 hours

Title: Evaluating Creative and Innovative Ideas
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval.  To start the process, press the "Add to Learning Plan" button, then press the "Request Approval," button, and finally press the "Submit" button. If there are any questions, a training department representative will contact you.  An e-mail communication will be sent to you when the course has been approved.

CourseDescription=Proposing ideas is just the first step to innovation. But for every thousand ideas you generate, only one may have what it takes to make a real difference in your organization. Many great ideas will remain just that--ideas. Unless they have true commercial potential, or offer real advantages, they are destined to remain in the mental "incubator."

To determine which ideas are worthy of further attention and which should be discarded, you will need to expose them to evaluation. This can be a painful time, when you feel protective of "your baby." After all, up to this point, you may have been guarding your idea against any criticism.

Yet in a hard-nosed business world, all ideas must undergo intense scrutiny to enable their true potentials to be assessed.
In this course, you'll be determining what aspects of creative and innovative ideas require evaluation, and then exploring common evaluation techniques, such as Return on Investment (ROI), SWOT analyses, and the Six Thinking Hats theory.
Duration = 3.5 hours

Title: Leading High-performance On-site Teams
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval.  To start the process, press the "Add to Learning Plan" button, then press the "Request Approval," button, and finally press the "Submit" button. If there are any questions, a training department representative will contact you.  An e-mail communication will be sent to you when the course has been approved.

CourseDescription=Successful on-site teams are characterized by clear direction, team member trust, and effective communication and conflict-resolution strategies. In the early stages of team development, leaders must set up structures and processes that support the development of these team characteristics.

This course offers strategies for leading an on-site team during the first two stages of team development--forming and storming. It outlines steps for defining a project and offers strategies for gaining commitment and building trust among team members. It also presents techniques for encouraging communication and collaboration. Finally, this course provides easy to follow steps for resolving conflicts. By using these strategies, team leaders can build high-performance on-site teams.
TargetAudience=Managers, team leaders, supervisors, directors, and group leaders
Duration =  3.5 hours

Title: Planning an Effective Business Meeting
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval. CourseDescription=If you are in a business that has meetings, you know how much time is spent in them. A recent survey of 2000 business leaders indicated that managers spend over fifty percent of their time in meetings. That same study indicated that managers felt that about one third of those meetings were unproductive. This course will present you with information that will help you improve the quality of your meetings. It will help you develop strategies necessary for preparing effective business meetings, by carefully considering the importance of all the components of the meeting, including people, place, purpose, time, agenda, and atmosphere.
TargetAudience=Business professionals who want to develop effective facilitation skills, members of boards or committees, meeting participants, executive assistants, and individuals who want to prepare themselves for a business environment.
Duration=2.5 hours

Title: Getting the Most from Business Documents
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval.  To start the process, press the "Add to Learning Plan" button, then press the "Request Approval," button, and finally press the "Submit" button. If there are any questions, a training department representative will contact you.  An e-mail communication will be sent to you when the course has been approved.

CourseDescription=How often have you or one of your colleagues stayed at work late to finish an important report or proposal to meet a deadline? Then two days later you receive a call from the intended recipient asking you where the report is. You faxed it over and it got lost in their fax room. Now you've missed the benefit of having met your deadline. This familiar scenario illustrates the importance of selecting an appropriate document type and delivery method for your written business documents. "Getting the Most from Business Documents" explains the different business document types such as memos, reports, and proposals and the best uses for each. The course shows you how to align the message content, document type, and delivery method--Internet, fax, mail, courier, and so on--so that your business documents receive the right level of attention and achieve their designated purpose. Independent topics address five of the most commonly used business documents. You work hard on your business writing. Don't waste that effort with careless choice of document type or inappropriate delivery method. Learn how to prepare, lay out, and deliver business documents that reflect well on you and your company.
Duration = 4.0 hours

Title: Handling Conflict
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval.  To start the process, press the "Add to Learning Plan" button, then press the "Request Approval," button, and finally press the "Submit" button. If there are any questions, a training department representative will contact you.  An e-mail communication will be sent to you when the course has been approved.

CourseDescription=No one can complete a working career without experiencing conflict, so it is essential for you to handle this conflict in the most effective way.

To handle conflict well, you need to build a repertoire of techniques. These techniques require you to behave differently from your natural instincts at times.

Therefore, a good starting point is to establish what your instinctive approaches to conflict are, and where these attitudes stem from.
 
This will enable you to decide on a range of different approaches to conflict, based on a spectrum that goes from being only concerned about your own needs, to only being concerned about other people's needs. This spectrum gives rise to five possible strategies for dealing with conflict.

Whatever strategy you apply, some core techniques will make you more effective. These involve three main actions: confronting the conflict, communicating with the other party, and determining an acceptable outcome.

Sometimes, the conflict in the workplace just surrounds you, even though you are not involved directly. You then have to learn how to avoid taking sides, or becoming a scapegoat.
TargetAudience=Anyone who has to deal with conflict in the workplace.
Duration = 3.5 hours

Title: Taking on a Management Role
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval.  To start the process, press the "Add to Learning Plan" button, then press the "Request Approval," button, and finally press the "Submit" button. If there are any questions, a training department representative will contact you.  An e-mail communication will be sent to you when the course has been approved.

CourseDescription=What does becoming a manager involve? What skills are needed to be a good one, and what will others expect of you? These are all natural questions for anyone who is about to become a manager, or who has recently been promoted.

Moving into a first management role represents possibly one of the biggest changes in your working life. The transition from player to manager is an exciting, but challenging, one. It takes most people out of an area in which they have been comfortable and successful for some time into more unfamiliar territory. Moving from being one of the team to leading it can be daunting.
TargetAudience=Anyone who is about to be promoted, or who has just been promoted to a first management or supervisory role
Duration=3.5 hours

Title: Effective Intercultural Relationships
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval.  To start the process, press the "Add to Learning Plan" button, then press the "Request Approval," button, and finally press the "Submit" button. If there are any questions, a training department representative will contact you.  An e-mail communication will be sent to you when the course has been approved.

CourseDescription=In a shrinking world, businesses operate across borders, whether they are borders between neighborhoods or borders between countries. All of these bordered areas, large and small, represent differing cultures. Whether comfortable or abroad, chances are, your business deals with people of varying cultures on a daily basis. In today's expansive work environment, employees, co-workers, customers, vendors, and business partners can all have a different cultural background from yours. The most obvious cultural differences you encounter are language and dress. But there are a multitude of subtler ways in which people from different cultures vary in their behavior. If you don't understand the ways in which they might differ, you're risking your business communication and relationships being misunderstood. When operating interculturally, mistakes are easily made when you take appearances and meaning for granted. This course lends significance to the term "multiculturalism." In this course, you will learn about the many ways in which mini- to macro-cultural behavior and attitude can vary, around the corner and around the world. This course will prepare you to understand and relate better to people with different cultural backgrounds, thus making your business deals with them easier and helping you avoid costly misunderstandings.
TargetAudience=Any employee at any level who deals with cultural diversity in the workplace, whether at home or abroad
Duration = 2.0 hours

Title: Cultivating Winning Attitudes
Description: This highly interactive leadership program will help participants build the essential skills they need to motivate and inspire their teams to achieve their true potential. Participants will learn cooperative games and activities that will help rejuvenate and revitalize their teams. The focus is squarely on mastering techniques proven to build cooperation among team members and get them actively involved, thinking and pulling together as a team.

Title: Effective Intergender Relationships
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval.  To start the process, press the "Add to Learning Plan" button, then press the "Request Approval," button, and finally press the "Submit" button. If there are any questions, a training department representative will contact you.  An e-mail communication will be sent to you when the course has been approved.

CourseDescription=Guess what. Men and women are different. Socially, the differences offer an attractive mystique. But in professional situations and in the workplace, the significant differences in male and female communication styles can cause problems. There is no denying that women and men vary significantly in their verbal inflections and tone, their body language, and how they listen to others. They pick up on different cues in conversations, and often the meaning they interpret is not the message the speaker intends. It's almost as if the two genders speak different dialects. And, in fact, that's nearly the case. Communication confusion and breakdown between men and women at work can lead to inefficiency and expensive business errors. This course explains the differences in the language and communication behavior of men and women so each can more easily understand what the other is really saying. The course also provides tips on how to modify your own communication behavior to be more clearly understood by the opposite gender.
TargetAudience=Anyone who works or interacts with the opposite gender in a professional setting
Duration = 2.0 hours

Title: Initiating and Planning a Project
Description:

CourseDescription=Initiating and Planning are crucial phases in developing and executing any successful project. Companies that are embarking on a new project initiative must assign people to gather facts and decide what exactly they want to produce and how they are going to produce it. This course examines which factors should weigh in during the project selection process and how to effectively plan a project from beginning to end.
TargetAudience=This course is targeted toward a diverse range of managers and staff members who wish to acquire the necessary skills to successfully manage small to medium sized projects.
Duration = 2.0 hours

Title: Analyzing Workplace War Zones
Description:
**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval.  To start the process, press the "Add to Learning Plan" button, then press the "Request Approval," button, and finally press the "Submit" button. CourseDescription=A team would be worthless if everyone agreed on every issue. The purpose of teams is to facilitate discussions and foster creativity. Sometimes the same discussions and creative thoughts that help the team can also bring about conflict. Nobody is perfect and not everyone is going to get along. It's important that teams identify and target any problems before they escalate. At the end of this course you'll have the skills needed to recognize why teams stop working, identify why battles begin, learn how to target team problems, and develop the skills to discuss problems as a team.
Duration=2.5 hours

**Taking this course may result in a financial expense and therefore requires approval.
