Title: Komplexní řešení problémů
Description:
Introduction:

Participants will learn how to approach problems objectively and systematically, with a combination of analytical and creative thinking.

Objectives:

Understanding the internal logic of solving different types of problems
Adoption of procedures for the complete solution of the problem from the beginning when the problem is identified till the final resolution
Introduction to the key analytical techniques for understanding problems and uncovering their essence and training in practice
Introduction to useful and practical creative techniques aimed to find appropriate methods to solve problems and their training
Clarification of the distinction between "finding a solution" and "resolving"
SWOT or team SWOT in relation to problem solving
Specific situations from participant’s practice

Target Group:

Employees in non-managerial positions whose job it is to solve complex problems (both individual and team ones) and who need to acquire the knowledge and basic skills in this area, also managers with specific need in the area of problem solving

Main Topics:

Decision making in problem solving process (key moments in the problem solving process - what, when, how and who decides)
Problem analysis (both traditional and modern methods of problem analysis and clarification of their nature, causes and context: SWOT analysis, Ishikawa, Pareto analysis, stakeholder analysis, Ekotest, PEST analysis, Scenario Planning)
Problem solving (practical tools to find solutions of problems: Disney Strategy, 6 Hats, Balint Technique, Mentors Table, State Line)
Creative and other techniques (other practical tools to find solutions to the problems: different types of brainstorming, dialogue …)

Duration of the training:                     2 days

Min-max number of participants:       8 - 15 participants

Language:                                           Czech

Supplier:                                             External training agency ČNP

Location:                                            Ahold location (internal training room)

Overnight Stay:                                   No / Based on standard request

Costs:  According to the number of participants. These costs will be charged on your department cost center; even when you are not attending the course - based on a late apology (14 days and less before the date of the training).

Key words:

business insight, problem solving, analysis, problem solving techniques, competency training, development training, how to analyze and solve problems, analytical thinking, creative approach, decision-making

Title: DEMO - Školenie bezpečnosti práce s potravinami
Beer Garden Training
Description:
Be a Better Neighbor and help us say NO to underage and impaired drinking. You may just save someone's life.

Being a responsible alcohol vendor is our job and our responsibility. We can make someone's day by asking for their ID while we keep our community safe by refusing to sell to minors or visibly impaired customers. It's not always easy, but it's our job to know regulations for:


	The hours of operation for sale of alcoholic beverages
	Storage of alcoholic beverages
	Purchasing, receiving and selling alcholic beverages
	Consumption rules
	Return policy for alcoholic beverages
	RAMP (Responsible Alcohol Management Program) Guidelines:
	Legal implication of selling alcohol to minors
	The acceptable forms of identification
	How to execute proper carding practices (FEAR)
	The difference between visible/legal intoxication and what the Licensee is responsible for
	When the service of alcohol should be stopped (at first sign of impairment)

Title: Týmová spolupráce (Teamwork)
Description:
Introduction: Do you want to understand yourself better in terms of how you behave at work, in your work team, but also in your family? Are you looking for a way to reinforce the consistency of your team and get the most from mutual cooperation? You will become acquainted with the typical stages of team development and team dynamics. You will learn which team role is closest to you and learn how to assess your colleagues based on the practical typology of team roles. Furthermore you will become acquainted with benefits and risks of different team roles for team performance. The course is interactive (model situations, self-reflection,  exercises, practical application).

Objectives: To understand ourselves and the way we function at work, team, but also in our family, To recognize the benefits and possible risks of our own communication and work styles, Simple personal typology that makes communication with others easier, To learn about characteristics of an effective team, typical stages team development and its dynamics, To map out what are the basic rules for the allocation of tasks within the team, to know the importance of team and individual motivation, Conflicts in teams, how to solve and prevent them; instructions and recommendations to promote mutual respect and tolerance, To set the action plan for me and our team, To try and practice effective teamwork using model situations, To understand the impact of changes in the company on teams and individuals; and to find ways to strengthen communication with others and to improve mutual cooperation as much as possible

Target Group: Teams (newly built, with more new members, or teams in need of setting up new more efficient rules of operation); please be aware that the whole team is the best Target Group for the training not the individual

Main Topics:

Team definition and characteristics of an effective one
Corporate mergers and the impact on corporate culture
Team development stages
Team communication
How to explain efficiently
Team roles
Team conflicts and their solutions
Feedback

Supplier:                                             External training agency TCC

Costs:  According to the number of participants. These costs will be charged on your department cost center; even when you are not attending the course - based on a late apology (14 days and less before the date of the training).

Key words: team, team cooperation, development training, competency training, change, change management

Description:
What is the one thing that is constant in this world? CHANGE.

Organizations don't change, people do and we, as leaders, need to be prepared to help ease our team's journey towards new ways of working in this ever-changing environment. To do that effectively, we need new tools and that's where Leaders@Change can help. Come explore:

Title: Franklin Covey: Speed of Trust Foundations
Description:
Trust is the new currency in today's connected, collaborative world and trust begins with you.

Low trust individuals become suspicious and disengaged, resulting in decreased productivity and increased costs. But on high trust teams, individuals are more engaged and communicate openly with each other and that leads to increased productivity and decreased costs. In The Speed of Trust Foundations you'll use real work situations to:


	Practice the 13 Behaviors of High Trust to develop, restore, and extend trust.
	Create a Trust Action Plan to increase personal credibility and influence.
	Practice communicating transparently, respectfully, and directly.
	Identify how to extend appropriate levels of trust with co-workers.
	Improve your track record of keeping commitments through a Peer Accountability Process.

Title: UAT training
Description:
Algemeen
De training is voor een geselecteerde groep van ETOS medewerkers in het kader van het IRIS project. De training is ter voorbereiding om het testtraject voor de Oracle applicaties uit te kunnen voeren. De cursisten zijn geselecteerd om deze systeemsoftware te gaan testen. 
Leerdoel
Met deze opleiding zijn de cursisten in staat het testen van de systeemsoftware uit te voeren. Wat zij moeten testen en hoe zij moeten testen. 
Ze krijgen daarnaast inzicht in wat software testing inhoudt en raken bekend met de testprincipes en testscenario’s.

Inhoud training
Ter voorbereiding van het testen krijgen zij inzicht in de samenhang tussen de veranderende organisatieprocessen en de nieuwe Oracle applicaties. 
De cursisten krijgen de vaardigheid om te kunnen navigeren door de schermen met behulp van het lesmateriaal (de zogenaamde Storyboards). 
De cursisten leren de schermen te lezen en zelfstandig systeemgerelateerde informatie op te zoeken in de Storyboards. 
De testcoördinator legt uit wat software testing, testprincipes en testscenario's inhouden en zal de weken na de training het testen leiden.

Title: Řízení času
Description:
Brief introduction: Do you sometimes feel that some people manage to do more and better than you? Maybe you noticed that family and hobbies recede into the background before the job responsibilities? Would you like to do something about it? Maybe you could try to better manage yourself and your time.

Objectives: To show examples of causes and consequences of not managing time and tasks or even failure, To focus on the shortcomings in the organization of my own work and to create a working day record, To become familiar with the tools of self-management - time management in the workplace, Repetition of how to set a goal, to focus on it, rehearsing procedures for setting priorities during  planning; and learning to create a feasible task schedule, trying some methods of planning and self-organization in practice, To be able to apply the principles of the importance and urgency in prioritizing; Mapping inefficient or redundant activities, To familiarize with practical tools of  managing work activities, To practice sorting  and delivering tasks during the workday, To focus on dealing  with stress, to recognize how it arises and its impacts, To rehearse basic stress management techniques

Target Group: Employees in non/managerial positions who need to acquire the knowledge and basic skills in time management, or managers with specific training needs in this respective area.

Main Topics: Self-Management, Time management at workplace, Objectives, priorities and tasks, Planning, scheduling tools and practical principles for scheduling, Stress and how to work with it, Training Stress Techniques
Applications to Practice: Setting up an action plan for participants’ development in time management

Duration of the training:                     2 days

Min-max number of participants:       8 - 15 participants

Language:                                           Czech

Supplier:                                             External training agency TCC

Location:                                            Ahold location (internal training room)

Overnight Stay:                                   No / Based on standard request

Costs:  According to the number of participants. These costs will be charged on your department cost center; even when you are not attending the course - based on a late apology (14 days and less before the date of the training).

Key words: time, the importance and urgency, time management, time management, operational excellence, operational excellence, competency training, development training, stress, stress management techniques, time management

Description:

Title: Přehled o oboru 2 (Rozhodování a řešení problémů 2)
Description:
Účastníci se v této pokročilé úrovni učí definovat, analyzovat a řešit problémy a konflikty a osvojovat si techniky, které podporují nalezení správného řešení problémů a tvorbu nových nápadů. Výhodou je, že na toto dvoudenní školení navazuje praktický follow-up workshop, kde si účastníci osvojené znalosti prakticky vyzkouší a získají formou koučinku okamžitou zpětnou vazbu. 

Základní témata: 
- Jak včas rozpoznat a efektivně projednat problém 
- Metody a techniky řešení problémů 
- Porozumění a užití technik pro: stanovování cíků, tvorbu nápadů, výběr možností, plánování 
- Případová studie - řešení problémů a užití probraných technik pro jejich užití 

Rozsah školení: 
2 dny školení+ 1 den workshopu (cca po měsíci)

Místo konání: 
hotel v Praze či blízkém okolí

Školitel: 
školení je realizováno prostřednictvím externí agentury


Část kompetence "Přehled o oboru", která je postihnuta tímto školením: 
„Činí vhodná rozhodnutí a bere v úvahu různé úhly pohledu. Je zdatný/zdatná při získávání a analyzování informací z různých zdrojů. Používá nápady a kreativitu k dosahování výsledků. Vidí skryté problémy a chápe souvislosti mezi jednotlivými událostmi...“

Title: Prezentační dovednosti – Jak vystoupit, zaujmout a prodat
Description:
Introduction: Participants will learn the basic fundamentals of presentation and communication skills, ie. how to prepare a presentation,  how to communicate properly, how to approach different kinds of auditorium, how to deal with objections and inquiries; and last but not least how to give and receive feedback.

Objectives: Developing presentation skills of the participants
Participants will they learn how their appearance and non-verbal communication affect presentation success, as well as how to properly structure a presentation, how to choose  how, when and what should we communicate to keep their audience's attention.
Ways of working with demanding audience
To learn how to work with feedback

Target Group: Employees in non-managerial positions who need to acquire basic presentation skills and knowledge, and also managers with specific training needs in this area.

Main Topics: Selfpresentation
Nonverbal Communication
Structure of the presentation
Techniques used to maintain the audience’s attention
Audience typology
Feedback - accepting and giving one

Duration of the training:         2 days

Min-max number of participants:       8 - 15 participants

Language:                                           Czech

Supplier:                                             External training agency MotivP

Location:                                            Ahold location (internal training room)

Overnight Stay:                                   No / Based on standard request

Costs:  According to the number of participants. These costs will be charged on your department cost center; even when you are not attending the course - based on a late apology (14 days and less before the date of the training).

Key words: The influence and impact, Impact and Influence, presentation skills, objection, competency training, development training, communication, presentation, feedback

Title: Základy vyjednávání
Description:
Tento kurz je určen pro zaměstnance centrály, kteří v rámci své pozice aktivně a často vyjednávají s třetími stranami. Dozvíte se základní principy řešení sporů, vyjednávací styly, strategické aspekty vyjednávání



Základní témata:

- základní principy řešení sporů

- zvládání emocí při vyjednávání

- zájmy a postoje při vyjednávání

- základní vyjednávací styly

- příprava na vyjednávání

- strategické aspekty vyjednávání

2 dny bez ubytování



Místo konání:

Praha



Školitel:

školení je realizováno prostřednictvím externí agentury

"Ovlivňuje ostatní z manažerské i nemanažerské pozice. Dokáže přesvědčit věcnými argumenty a různými způsoby. Komunikuje věcně, výstižně, včas a způsobem vhodným pro cílové posluchače.“

 

Klíčová slova:

rozvojové školení, spor, postoj, vyjednávací styl, obchod, dohoda

Title: Vyjednávání pro zaměstnance M,F&M 1
Description:
V tréninkových programech, zaměřených na vyjednávání v obchodě, se soustřeďujeme na ověření základních znalostí a dovedností a velmi rychle směřujeme k pokročilým vyjednávacím disciplínám, zejména potom ke strategickým tématům (jak kombinovat vyjednávací styly), přípravě na vyjednávání, analýze moci a zájmů, sebepoznání a zvládání stresu a - to zcela nejvíce - poznávání partnerů z hlediska jejich osobnosti, myšlení, dovedností a návyků, analýze jejich neverbální komunikace a využití těchto znalostí a dovedností v obchodní praxi. A pochopitelně nácvik vyjednávání v praxi na praktických příkladech, včetně zvládání vybraných obtížných situací.

Průběh školení: 
Poznávání a ovlivňování lidí, zájmů a mocenských aspektů vyjednávání
- Poznávání lidí z pohledu jejich motivů, hodnot a zájmů
- Poznávání lidí z pohledu jejich komunikačních, vztahových a vyjednávacích preferencí
- Sebepoznání a důsledky sebepoznání pro vyjednávání s partnery různých zaměření
- Příprava na vyjednávání, analýza moci a zájmů, definice vyjednávacího prostoru
- Stanovení vyjednávacích taktik a tvorba alternativních scénářů
- Práce s tlakem a informacemi, získávání informací od protistrany

Vyjednávání v nezvyklých a obtížných podmínkách
- Vyjednávání v nerovných podmínkách (včetně vyjednávání v podmínkách dominance)
- Zvládání konfliktních a problémových typů vyjednavačů
- Analýza neverbální komunikace, poznávání a zvládání vyjednávacích triků
- Strategické cíle a strategicky výhodný styl vyjednávání
- Kombinace vyjednávacích stylů s cílem nastavit strategicky výhodný typ vztahů
- Zvládání zátěže a stresu při vyjednávání v obtížných podmínkách

Title: Addyi REMS Training
Description:
Working in our Pharmacy comes with a lot of responsibility and part of that is knowing about policies and procedures related to specific pharmaceuticals. 

Having a clear understanding of this information will help you protect yourself, the company, and the customer and keep everyone living healthy. We can mitigate the increased risk of hypotension and syncope associated with Addyi due to an interaction with alcohol by ensuring both prescribers and pharmacists know the increased risk and counsel our customers accordingly.

Title: Nascholing vakopleiding  drogist 2017
Description:
Zorg dat je bijblijft!

‘Zorg dat je bijblijft’ is een volledig digitale en interactieve nascholing. Hiermee hou je continu je kennis en adviesvaardigheden actueel zodat je je klanten altijd het beste advies kunt geven. Ook blijf je op de hoogte van interessant nieuws uit de drogisterijwereld via de speciale nieuwspagina. En: de nascholing kun je ook op je smartphone of tablet doen. Lekker makkelijk! De stof is zo verdeeld dat je elk jaar een stukje doet en continu bezig bent met het bijhouden van jouw kennis en vaardigheden. Ieder jaar rond je circa vijf magazines af. Die kun je gedurende het jaar doorlopen op een moment dat het jou uitkomt. Je start de nascholing na het behalen van het diploma drogist.

Verplicht voor medewerkers met het diploma drogist.
Na 1 jaar verleng je jouw inschrijving.

Voorkennis: Diploma drogist vereist

Title: Managing Up
Description:
Are you ready to take charge, do good work, and get noticed for it? If you don't manage up, you may never have the opportunity to manage down. This course is designed to help you learn how to maximize your career by managing up. Leadership consultant and best-selling author Roberta Matuson explains what managing up is, what it isn't, and why it is important to achieving success. First, she helps you decipher the management style of your boss. Then she outlines techniques for building a strong relationship as well as how to avoid mistakes. She also addresses the need to master office politics, how to navigate your workplace effectively, and how to boost your performance by maximizing your personal and positional power.

Lynda.com is a PMI Registered Education Provider. This course qualifies for professional development units (PDUs). To view the activity and PDU details for this course, click here.

The PMI Registered Education Provider logo is a registered mark of the Project Management Institute, Inc.

Title: Finding a Sponsor
Description:
In our competitive workforce, it's crucial that you stand out from the other candidates vying for the same opportunities. Sponsors—individuals within an organization who see your potential and point you in the right direction—can help you define your personal brand and act as your advocate. In this course, executive coach Simon T. Bailey explains how sponsors can guide you along in your career. Learn about the differences between sponsors and mentors and discover how to assess and clarify your career goals, so you can choose the most appropriate sponsor. Once you identify and secure a sponsor, see how you can build a trusting relationship and continue to learn from them and their sphere of influence as you grow your career.

Lynda.com is a PMI Registered Education Provider. This course qualifies for professional development units (PDUs). To view the activity and PDU details for this course, click here.

The PMI Registered Education Provider logo is a registered mark of the Project Management Institute, Inc.

Title: Dealing with a Difficult Boss
Description: Author and professional coach Todd Dewett helps you address the challenge of working with a difficult boss by helping you identify, understand, and manage the triggers that contribute to your problematic relationship. He also outlines actions you can take, such as correctly documenting events, knowing when to speak up, and—sometimes—not taking any action at all.

Title: AHOLD Values
Description: Ahold Values

Title: Clozapine REMS Training
Description:
Working in our Pharmacy comes with a lot of responsibility and part of that is knowing about policies and procedures related to specific pharmaceuticals.

Having a clear understanding of this information will help you protect yourself, the company, and the customer and keep everyone living healthy. We can minimize the risk of severe neutropenia associated with the use of Clozapine by keeping prescribers, pharmacists and customers informed.

Language:  English

Title: Sanofi US Pharmacovigilance Adverse Drug Experience Reporting Overview
Description:
The health and wellness of our customers is of the utmost importance in our store pharmacies.

For that reason, it is critical that all Pharmacists understand adverse drug experiences and the impacts they can have on our customers and our business. This includes knowing:


	The meaning of adverse drug experience
	The reason for communicating adverse drug experiences
	Reporting requirements and the timeframe for reporting
	Your role as a Sanofi contractor
	The types of information you will be asked to communicate
	Who to contact and how to contact them

Title: Coaching for Success
Description:
"This course focuses on all aspects of coaching and how it impacts our associates and our business.

Learning objectives for the course include: discuss how changes impact the marketplace and our business; define what coaching is and is not; review the benefits and barriers to coaching; explain and describe how to coach effectively; demonstrate how to measure your successes in coaching; define how to motivate different age groups; discuss the importance of feedback; and describe the importance of assessing our leadership behaviors."

Title: Satisfying DEA Standards When Dispensing Controlled Substances
Description:
The health and wellness of our customers is of the utmost importance in our store pharmacies. 

For that reason, it is critical that all Pharmacists understand what controlled substances are, the dangers they can present, and how to manage their disbursement effectively and within company and legal regulation. To support your compliance and your ability to satisfy the Pharmacist's responsibilities, this program will prepare you to:


	Describe your obligations as a Pharmacist regarding the dispensing of controlled substances
	Explain the DEA's "corresponding responsibility" rule and expectations of Pharmacists
	Identify typical "red flags" that may indicate a prescription for controlled substances was not issued for a legitimate medical purpose
	Recognize situations that require special attention
	Explain appropriate actions that can resolve red flags
	Locate and access tools and resources to help you satisfy your legal obligations.


Language:  English

Title: Closer OJT
Description:
"The on-the-job Closer training program will teach associates the proper process, procedures, guidelines, regulations, and responsibilities involved with closing a store at the end of a  business day.

Learning objectives include: delegating tasks appropriately to front end associates based on job descriptions, responding to the needs of the front end, closing procedures, responding to the needs of the store as the manager-in-charge, providing exceptional service and product quality, resolving basic file maintenance issues, identifying store associates as minors through proper dress code (i.e. name badges), enforcing compactor and equipment use regulations, and complying with company and government policies"

Title: Expert ondersteuning Diversey
Description:
Korte introductie: Kwaliteitsmedewerkers die structureel hoog scoren bij Diversey, bieden we de mogelijkheid om zich verder te ontwikkelen en "expert" te worden. We belonen hiermee de medewerkers die de basis op orde hebben en klaar zijn voor "the next level".
Een consultant van Diversey loopt samen met de kwaliteitsmedewerker en de teamleider een winkelronde en bekijken de kritische punten stapsgewijs. De consultant geeft toelichting en tips aan de kwaliteitsmedewerker en de teamleider. Aan het einde van de winkelronde bespreken jullie met elkaar de bevindingen.
Bereid je goed voor op de komst van Diversey. Bespreek met je teamleider welke vragen je wilt stellen en op welke gebieden je meer informatie wilt.

Voorwaarden om deel te nemen zijn:
- De winkel scoort structureel (minstens 3x opeenvolgend) een "blauwe" score.
- De laatste score van Diversey is minimaal 95%.
- In de "Scan kwaliteitsmedewerker" zijn er minimaal 28 van de 34 punten met "ja" beantwoord.
- De OM kan jaarlijks van zijn winkelgroep maximaal 2 winkels hiervoor aanmelden.

Taal: Nederlands

Leverancier: Diversey

Locatie: Ahold locatie (winkel)

Overnachting: Nee

Kosten: € 150,-- per winkelronde. Voor franchise worden deze doorbelast, voor de eigen winkels niet.

Aanmeldingsprocedure: De OM meldt een winkel hiervoor aan d.m.v. een e-mail aan ahold.learning@ahold.com met daarin de volgende gegevens: winkelnummer, naam en telefoonnummer SM. Diversey neemt vervolgens contact op met de SM om de winkelronde in te plannen. Alle deelnemers aan de winkelronde (KM, TL, (A)SM) krijgen deze activiteit op hun studiehistorie in ELM.

Trefwoorden: Kwaliteit, up-to-date kwaliteitsmedewerker, diversey, diversy

Peapod Pick Up (PUP) is a service that allows our customers the convenience of online shopping so they can select their items and schedule a pick up time and location that best suites their needs. As a PUP Associate, your engagement and assistance with our customers' orders will keep them smiling and returning back for more!

You will also learn guidelines for explaining to employees the impact of their problem behavior. In addition, you will learn the correct way to address negative employee responses, as well as how to respond when to employee reactions such as denial, excuses, and shifting blame.

This course is designed for Cash Office Associates. 
The purpose of this course is to ensure compliance with the US Patriot Act which includes any money transfers and money order sales and also to maintain a common training program amongst the Divisions. Any violations of this program could subject our company and associates to severe criminal and civil penalties and could seriously damage the good name of our stores and company.

Title: Handling Workplace Change as an Associate
Facilitating Change
Description:
"This course shows leaders how to make change a positive experience by focusing on a shared vision, building business partnerships, championing ongoing improvement, and creating an environment in which learning is encouraged.

Learning objectives for the course include: explore how organizational change affects a leader’s role, learn the predictable phases of change and strategies for managing them, identify and practice the four roles for leading in an environment of change, develop a clear set of priorities for the leader’s role, learn how to help others feel more comfortable with change, establish greater role clarity for participants and others, and plan actions to achieve an organization’s vision, champion continuous improvement and build business partnerships."

Title: Fuel Workshop for Store Management
Description:
You have to know a lot to work at one of our fuel stations and you have to know even more to manage one.

You will be scheduled for this workshop as soon as one is available. Workshops are conducted quarterly by the Fuel Specialists to provide managers the details they need to know in order to successfully manage the fuel station. This includes:


	Regulatory / Compliance Requirements
	Fuel Plus One
	Fuel Facility Amenities & Overall Appearance
	Customer Engagement
	Supply Chain
	P&L
	Safety & Security

Need help? Click here

Title: Handling Workplace Change as an Employee
Description: Workplace change is hard. In this course, Chris Croft explains why we struggle with change, and shares many practical techniques that can help you manage—and even thrive—in a world of constant change. Chris begins the course with general overview of change, explaining why most of us dislike it and how to prepare for the changes you'll inevitably encounter throughout your life. Next, he outlines five common types of workplace change—restructuring, layoffs, new initiatives, starting a new role in a team, and getting off to a good start with a new boss—and provides strategies for dealing with each. Even as he addresses particular types of workplace change, Chris shares helpful techniques that could easily apply to other changes in your life.

Title: Leading Effective Meetings
Description:
"This course equips associates with tools and techniques to effectively conduct meetings.
 
Learning objectives for the course include: identify the difference between an ineffective and effective meetings, learn how pitfalls in meetings can be prevented, learn proper steps to prepare for meetings, learn how to handle challenging meeting situations, learn intervention techniques to resolve problems and keep meetings on track, demonstrate increased effectiveness of leading meetings, and utilize the tools provided for conducting effective meetings."

Title: Leading for Optimal Performance
Description:
"This course helps leaders improve their roles as coaches and developers of team skills.  Leaders learn how to maximize involvement, productivity, motivation, and growth.
 
Learning objectives for the course include: learn the dynamics and benefits of working as a team; use the characteristics that all teams share to create a profile of the team; discover the challenges your team faces in each of the four stages of team development; learn the critical team success factors—purpose, process, communication, commitment, involvement, and trust—that drive team performance; demonstrate increased ownership of team performance by assessing and taking responsibility for improving team effectiveness and performance; and focus on high-priority actions and strategies that directly support the organization’s goals."

Title: Access Level 1
Description:
"In this course, associates will be introduced to the concept of the relational database, the Microsoft Office Access 2003 relational database application, and information management tools. Also, associates will learn how to design and create a new Access database.

Learning objectives include: overview of Microsoft Access, managing data, establishing table relationships, querying the database, designing forms, producing reports, planning a database, building the structure of a database, controlling data entry, finding and joining data, creating flexible queries, improving your forms, customizing your reports, and expanding the reach of your data."

Title: Access Level 2
Description:
"In this course, associates will extend their knowledge into some of the more specialized and advanced capabilities.

Learning objectives include: structuring existing data, writing advanced queries, simplifying tasks with macros, adding interaction and automation with macros, making forms more effective, making reports more effective, and maintaining an Access database."

Title: Vakdiploma Drogist
Description:
Het diploma Drogist heeft een wettelijke status. In de Wet op de Geneesmiddelenvoorziening (WOG) is vastgelegd dat de drogist de bevoegdheid heeft om niet-receptgeneesmiddelen af te leveren.

Het Vakdiploma Drogist vormt de basis voor de, door het ministerie van Volksgezondheid, Welzijn en Sport (VWS) verstrekte, geneesmiddelenvergunning en dus de bevoegdheid om zelfzorggeneesmiddelen te mogen verkopen.

Het niveau van deze opleiding is vergelijkbaar met MBO niveau 4, maar het is geen volledige MBO-opleiding (diploma geeft dus ook geen toegang tot een HBO-opleiding).

De opleiding tot drogist is opgesplitst in drie delen: Drogist en Zelfzorg 1, 2 & 3. De delen zijn zo opgebouwd dat het niet noodzakelijk is om ze in een bepaalde volgorde te doorlopen. De aankomend drogist bepaalt zelf met welke deel wordt gestart.

Title: Ahold Management Program
Description:
This program is part of the management development track for talents. A talent is an employee who is expected to grow at least two job grade levels or one hierarchical layer. Target group for this program are talents jobgrade 15-16 who want to grow to jobgrade 17-18. For these talents next steps are determined in Connect. For more information please read intranet, Leren & Ontwikkelen, Performance Management.

In this program participants are supported in their growth to a next leadership level. The
New European AMP is structured as a journey, along which participants are offered individual assignments, experiences at work, meetings with others, and workshops with the whole group. All of these activities have one aim: to allow participants to reflect on their own thinking and acting, and experiment with new thinking and acting that will help them in making a next career step. The AMP journey has five stages and takes approximately 10 months. 

The program and is provided by Kessels & Smit, The Learning Company. See also www.kessels-smit.com

Food workers are the first line of defense against contamination of food and food products. This short course:
covers basics in food safety in the retail environment 
presents ideas important to your job and to our customers 
teaches you how to handle food safely to protect yourself and our customers 
Key topics include:
personal hygiene 
time and temperature control 
prevention of cross contamination 
cleaning and sanitizing practices 
Disclaimer
This course was developed to orient food employees to the essentials of food safety and sanitation. Check with your local state or regulatory agency for its training requirements

Title: Holding Skip-Level Meetings
Description: A new type of meeting is emerging: skip-level meetings. Skip-level meetings are meetings you hold with employees who work for the managers who report to you—essentially "skipping" a level to learn more about the organization around you. In this short course, author Todd Dewett shows you how to successfully initiate and hold these meetings with employees who work for your direct reports. Discover how to set the tone, ask for candid feedback, and make meaningful connections. At the end of this course, you'll have the skills you need to build bridges across teams, and learn much more about your organization than you could through your direct reports alone.

Title: Body Language for Leaders
Description: Research shows that when your verbal and nonverbal signals are out of alignment, people are forced to choose between what they hear and what they see. And subconsciously, they'll believe your body language. In this course, workplace body-language expert Carol Kinsey Goman, PhD, reveals how body language is perceived and often misread, and shares the six nonverbal signals you need to know to make a positive first impression. She also discusses the importance of body language for leaders, and shows how you can establish leadership presence. Lastly, she provides simple and effective tips on communicating with gestures and stance.

Title: Naloxone Rescue Therapy for Opiod Overdose
Description: This CME/CE course is a recording of a live presentation. In this course, you'll hear panelists discuss the impact of naloxone in preventing opoid overdose and death. You'll also learn how to appropriately dispense naloxone, and hear strategies for increasing access to naloxone in your community.

Title: Word Level 1

Learning objectives include: creating a basic document, editing a document, formatting text, formatting paragraphs, proofing a document, adding tables, inserting graphic elements, and controlling page appearance."

Title: Omgaan met Verandering
Description:
De eerste workshop helpt mensen primair bij de emotionele verwerking en acceptatie van de komende veranderingen. Onderdeel van de verwerking is het accepteren van de situatie en het creëren van een nieuw toekomstperspectief. 

In deze workshop wordt in een aantal stappen op een actieve wijze ingegaan op:
- inzicht in veranderingsprocessen;
- verliesverwerking: hoe zien de opeenvolgende fasen in het verwerken van verlies eruit, zoals die bij vrijwel alle mensen te zien zijn? Wat speelt er en hoe kun je er het beste mee omgaan om 'sterker uit de strijd te komen'?
- DOORleven/doorLEVEN (bewustwording van noodzaak tot verwerken);
- een leven vol veranderingen.

*Deze workshop is alleen bedoeld voor HRservices medewerkers*

Title: Store Manager OJT
Description:
"This on-the-job training program is used to provide new Store Managers with comprehensive technical training and general knowledge of store operations.

Learning objectives for the training include: plan for and complete store walks with a purpose, understand the importance of proper merchandising its effect on the bottom line, ensure that CAO daily maintenance is consistently completed, use available shrink tools to track potential shrink issues, complete a quarterly budget and weekly projection and monitor weekly payroll using dashboard and effectively monitor store operating costs by clearly understanding the Profit & Loss statement and controllable expenses."

Školení ostatních kurzů pro zaměstnance centrály
Description:
E-learning "Komunikace na prodejny" je velmi doporučený pro všechny nové zaměstnance a povinný pro nové kolegy na odděleních Marketing, Komerční oddělení, Operační podpora - Systems, Sales a HR. 
Většina z nás potřebuje čas od času komunikovat s prodejnami. Pro správnou komunikaci ovšem existují určitá pravidla, aby nedocházelo k zahlcení prodejen a vaše zprávy byly doručeny včas a správně. Tento kratičký e-learning, vám pomůže orientovat se ve využití různých způsobů komunikace s prodejnami a správně formulovat zprávy z hlediska formy i obsahu. 
Školení vám nezabere více než 20 minut a v případě jakýchkoliv potíží nás informujte na cz.learning@ahold.com

Title: Opleiding AH Teamleider Verkoopklaar
Description:
De opleiding Teamleider Verkoopafhandeling bestaat uit trainingen en werkplekmodules.

De werkplekmodules worden in de winkel uitgevoerd en hebben een vaste opbouw:
- Inleiding
- Activiteiten en succesfactoren
- Informatie raadplegen
- Opdrachten

Bij het uitvoering wordt zoveel mogelijk verwezen naar theorie uit de handboeken. Aan de theorie zijn opdrachten gekoppeld die in de winkel onder begeleiding van een ervaren collega of het management moeten worden uitgevoerd, zodat de teamleider ervaring kan opdoen.

De trainingen worden verzorgd door trainers van Bureau Kangoeroe. De trainingen hebben een actief karakter. Er worden veel korte oefeningen gedaan die zoveel mogelijk direct aan de praktijk van de teamleider zijn gekoppeld.
Voorafgaande aan de trainingsdag voert de teamleider een voorbereidingsopdracht uit. Aan het eind van de trainingsdag maakt de teamleider een actieplan, of krijgt hij een praktijkopdracht mee. Het actieplan bespreekt hij met het management en met de opdracht gaat hij, onder begeleiding van het management, aan de slag.


Iedere module wordt afgesloten met een (elektronische) toets en een praktijkwaarneming die door het management aan de hand van waarnemingspunten wordt uitgevoerd.

Before you can serve/sell alcohol in our stores, your Store Employment Associate (SEA) must verify you’ve completed all training requirements. Directions for completing this item are below.

1.) Click REQUEST OBSERVATION 2.) Click ADD OBSERVERS and search for your SEA by first and last name 3.) Check the box to the right of their name and click ADD 4.) Click SEND to complete the process. 5.) The training item will appear on your SEA's learning plan and allow them to verify you have completed all training requirements.

Title: PSE Training
Description:
Did you know that over 50,000 people die abusing methamphetamines each year in the U.S.?

Methamphetamine abuse is a growing epidemic right here in our own country. Help us Be a Better Neighbor and keep our customers safe by ensuring you understand and follow the laws and procedures that safeguard against this dangerous problem including:


	What info is required in PSE log book
	How to log sales info
	Customer daily/monthly purchase limits
	Acceptable ID and how to verify ID
	How to match customer info
	Who can see PSE log book
	Where to store the PSE log book
	Where to store PSE products
	Where to find additional info


Language: English

Need help? Click here

Keywords: < pseudoephedrine, ephedrine, phenylpropanolamine, compliance, pharmacy>

Title: MSR's Role in Selling Help
Description:
This workshop focuses on how MSR's can have Help Me Today conversations that lead to our helping the customer tomorrow.

Prerequisite: Participants must have 3-6 months experience in the branch.

This course will reinforce the components of the Help Process and on the discrete skills that enable the MSR to sell:


	Products and services that help customers manage their money
	Referrals to partners to help customers save, grow, and protect their money
	The Member Service Rep's role in Selling Help is a great development opportunity for MSRs looking to advance to a Member Banking Specialist role or those who want to improve their ability to help members manage their money through Coast Capitals' helpful products & services


A 30-minute pre-course activity will be emailed to participants prior to the workshop.

Title: Leading through Conflict
Description:
Participants will learn tools and gain confidence to confront their toughest issues with courage, confidence and skill. This workshop will reposition the context around conflict and confrontation, providing the perspective of an explorer rather than a challenger, so that differing perceptions can be expressed and understood.

Please Note:  Registration By Invitation Only

Title: Leading Generations
Description:
Please Note:  Registration is By Invitation Only

Working effectively with a multi-generational workforce is one of the greatest challenges facing today’s leaders. By learning about generational issues, each participant will begin to recognize what motivates co-workers, managers, direct reports, etc. at different ages and stages of their career and lives. This understanding will lead to increased productivity, engagement, and teamwork.

Title: Business Membership Opening Workshop
Description:
The business membership opening experience should inspire our business customers to learn more about what we can offer to help their business. This one-day workshop integrates the technical and conversational aspects of opening business memberships. During the workshop, you’ll practice the end-to-end business membership opening processes while integrating:
• The mandatory requirements for business memberships and key processes, including technical procedures and necessary documentation and forms.
• The skills to have conversations that will enhance the business customer’s experience and initiate a deeper conversation with a business specialist.

Title: Leading & Managing Performance
Description:
Please note:  Registration is By Invitaiton Only

This two-day workshop will guide participants through the annual organizational and individual performance cycles. These cycles capture the ongoing process of setting and aligning goals and expectations to what matters most to Coast Capital’s current strategies, working toward those goals, and assessing the impact of that work.
Participants will consider how, as leaders, to engage their teams as they gain skill and confidence using tools and resources that enable each of the three stages of the individual performance cycle.

Title: Leading at Coast: Action Planning Workshop
Description:
Please Note:  Registration is By Invitation Only

This is a 1 day workshop with your fellow Leaders Who Inspire cohort. Participants plan your next steps as you complete the full Leaders Who Inspire Program.

Prerequisite: Completion of all mandatory Leaders Who Inspire curriculum.

Title: Leading Self through Change
Description:
Change can be challenging, and we often react unproductively to change. But we can also leverage change for greater satisfaction and performance on and off the job.

In this half –day workshop we’ll consider the impacts that change can have on people, including the change cycle, me issues, and potential reactions. We’ll examine how change can surface disruptive or unproductive reactions. We’ll identify our individual potential reactions and discuss the effect it can have on our brand. We’ll also explore strategies to increase our resiliency and become change leaders and navigators.

Title: PowerTools for Business Writers
Description: This powerful one-day program is for business people of all levels who need to communicate in writing to get their jobs done and influence results. Whether communicating through emails or letters, reports or presentations, this strategic program will help you ensure your writing is clear, influential, and received by your audience as you intended.

Title: B20: What’s it all about?
Description:
This half-day workshop is mandatory for all Leaders/Managers and individuals at Coast Capital Savings that are in credit-related roles including: all Branch credit-skilled staff, Small Business Managers/Sr. Managers, Approval Officers/Managers, Mortgage Underwriters/Managers, Contact Centre Lending Specialists/Managers, Mobile Lending Specialists/Managers, Credit Risk Review Specialists/Managers, Credit Auditors/Managers, Credit System Analyst/Manager, Retail Analysts/Manager, Sales Effectiveness Team/Manager and Retail Development Specialist. 

By the end of this workshop Participants will be able to:


	Describe the five B20 Fundamental Principles and relate them to the mortgage underwriting process at Coast Capital Savings
	Identify and apply the difference between current state and future state of each of the Retail Guideline changes
	Execute the end-to-end process of underwriting mortgage, integrating the new B20 Guidelines and processes


Pre-requisite:  Complete the Pre-Work found on the B20 Learning Activities mycoast page and then bring a calculator to the training session.

No Waitlist Option: You cannot waitlist for these courses. If the session if full, please register for another day & time with availability.

Examining Income Documents - Part 1
Description:
Welcome to Part 1 of this three part series. This series will help you to understand Coast Capital Savings requirements around income in order to determine the borrower’s ability to pay.

In this module you’ll learn how to determine what types of income documents are required. Allow 15 – 20 minutes to complete.

When you’re done, continue to Part 2, where you’ll learn how to analyze these documents in order to identify key pieces of information required to calculate Debt Service Ratios.

Finally, the last module in the series, Part 3 will help you put it all together by learning when certain types of income documents are needed.

Title: Personal Membership Opening Workshop MNLD Mar 2016
Coaching
Description: Use the time you spend coaching employees more effectively. Study best practices for listening, inquiry and reflection—a coach's most powerful tools. Learn how to identify which employees will be most receptive to coaching and which may need a different approach. A detailed example allows you to follow along in a coaching scenario to see best practices in action.

Title: Customer Focus
Description: In today’s business climate, it’s not enough to offer excellent products or services. Competitive advantage lies in how an organization continuously creates value for its customers. Understand how to use customer knowledge to deliver additional value and ultimately boost profitability. Learn how to build a customer-focused organization, in which everyone plays a role in serving the needs of actual and potential customers. Take away tips for increasing innovation throughout the organization and boosting employee satisfaction.

Title: Developing Employees
Description: Learn practical, easy ways to make employee development a regular part of your management routine. Explore strategies to keep high performers challenged and solid employees growing. Learn how to address underperformance. Includes information on building cross-cultural skills for global work.

Title: Difficult Interactions
Description: Learn the common causes of difficult interactions in the workplace and the benefits of effective conflict management. Take away tips for dealing with the emotions involved, for overcoming the barriers that prevent people from addressing conflict, and for managing conflict between employees.

Title: Innovation Implementation
Description: Bringing promising innovations to fruition is one of the toughest challenges organizations face. Learn about the major challenges—such as outright resistance and inadequate funding—you are likely to encounter as you work to transform a great idea into a new product, service, or business process or model. Discover potent tactics for surmounting those challenges, including laying a solid foundation of support among key stakeholders early in the implementation process. Build a compelling business case for your innovation and use it to keep your stakeholders engaged throughout the implementation process—even as your innovation hits the inevitable setbacks and frustrations. Understand how your organization allocates resources to innovation projects, so you can influence decisions such as who will be on the implementation team and how much funding your innovation will receive.

Title: Innovation and Creativity
Description: Find out what innovation and creativity really are and why they’re more important than ever to sustaining success. Learn how to build an intellectually diverse team to spark creativity, and how to establish the psychological and physical conditions that foster fresh thinking in your team. Explore powerful tactics for brainstorming ideas for new products, services, and business processes and models in your group—and for sourcing great ideas from outside your organization. Learn effective practices for streamlining your list to the most promising options for implementation.

Title: Leading People
Description: Learn how effective leaders inspire trust, motivate others, and define and communicate a vision. Discover why emotional intelligence is a leader's most powerful tool, and learn how to develop yours. Investigate how leadership responds to the imperatives of global business.

Title: Managing Your Boss
Description: Find out what managing your boss really means and why it matters more than ever. Diagnose key aspects of your working relationship with your boss—including your boss’s and your own strengths and weaknesses, work styles, and expectations. Build a strong partnership with your boss, including clarifying business priorities and discussing your professional development. Master the art of communicating effectively with your boss, including tactics for presenting problems and resolving disagreements. Deal with a variety of “bad” bosses.

Title: Meeting Management
Description: Prepare for a successful meeting by clarifying the purpose of the meeting, creating an agenda, and determining who to invite. Learn tactics for conducting a meeting effectively, such as ensuring that everyone at the meeting participates and keeping the discussion focused on the agenda. Understand common problems that can arise during a meeting, and find out how to resolve them. Master tactics for ending a meeting effectively and following up.

Title: Performance Measurement
Description: Understand what it means to measure a group’s or organization’s performance and why performance measurement is important. Gain familiarity with three common performance measurement systems. Learn what the “building blocks” of performance measurement are and how they relate to one another. Master a disciplined and do-able process for measuring your group’s performance—including determining what aspects of the group’s performance you should measure; choosing appropriate performance targets for your group; gathering and interpreting performance data on the metrics you’ve chosen; and avoiding common mistakes, such as tracking too many metrics or setting unrealistic targets. Includes a detailed case example of one manager who, through the performance measurement process, learned how her own management shortcomings were impeding her team members’ performance.

Title: Persuading Others
Description: Appreciate why the powers of persuasion are more critical than ever to being an effective professional. Learn tactics for strengthening your credibility, a fundamental step toward enhancing your persuasiveness. Learn how to analyze key aspects of people you want to persuade—such as how receptive they will be to your proposal and how they make decisions. Find out how to make persuasive appeals that not only strike your listeners as reasonable but that also excite their imagination—and win their commitment to your idea. Gain insight into what makes people resist your proposals and learn how to overcome the many types of resistance. Includes a section on persuasion “triggers” that you can activate to make your proposals even more compelling.

Title: Presentation Skills
Description: Learn how to analyze your audience and the setting (whether in-person or remote) so you can more effectively prepare for and deliver a presentation. Find out how to gather and use facts, evidence, stories, and media (including visual aids) to support the main messages you want to convey in your presentation. Discover tactics for structuring and managing the three critical components of your speech: the opening, the body, and the call to action. Explore best practices for rehearsing your presentations and for managing challenges that can arise as you’re delivering a talk, whether it’s “stage fright” or provocative, tough questions from your audience. Includes a section on evaluating your presentations to identify lessons you can apply to subsequent talks.

Title: Process Improvement
Description: Understand what a business process is and how to use business process improvement to enhance your organization’s efficiency and profitability. Learn how to detect signs of trouble, to identify problems by creating process activity flowcharts, to envision a better process, and to test your ideas. Understand the best ways to roll out the improved process and to ensure it delivers the desired results.

Title: Retaining Employees
Description: Reduce costly turnover and keep your best talent. Explore the most common reasons employees leave, and ways to avoid employee burnout. Discover how to hire well and create an appealing culture. Includes targeted strategies for retaining cultural minorities, women, and young workers.

Title: Strategy Planning and Execution
Description: To be successful, your organization needs a clear, sound strategy. Whether you initiate a strategic planning process for your unit or contribute to your organization’s overall strategic plan, you’ll follow the same steps. Also learn how to evaluate your unit’s execution of its action plans and reward successful results—to help it perform even better in the future.

Title: Team Creation
Description: Understand what makes teams unique and what forms they can take. Learn how to form a team by bringing together people with the skills and motivations needed to fulfill the team’s purpose and achieve its goals. Discover the keys to establishing accountability in your team, such as clear success measures, a realistic schedule and budget, and a sound project charter and plan. Lay the foundation for effective communication in your team, including mastering the use of communication technologies and document management systems. Foster the right culture in your team as well, including encouraging collaboration and ensuring that everyone understands what’s expected of them.

Title: Team Management
Description: Manage a team by building trust, strengthening team identity, and encouraging open communication and participation. Follow steps to resolve destructive conflict that arises in teams. Evaluate the performance of individuals and your team as a whole and reward appropriately.

Title: Leveraging Your Networks
Description: Learn how to build, strengthen and sustain effective networks, and the relationships that are their foundation.

JABC Dollars with Sense Facilitator Training
Description:
1.5 hour workshop is open to all Coast Capital employees and will provide you with the training and materials you need to volunteer to facilitate Junior Achievement BC’s Dollars with Sense program for grade 7-9 students in your community. 

Canadian youth are growing up a time when spending is easier than ever and debt is a way of life. That’s why Coast Capital Savings is the presenting sponsor of the Dollars with Sense financial literacy program – to empower youth to make smart, lifelong financial choices. Students are taught personal money management, how to live debt free and become savvy investors. This program needs volunteers in order to succeed – volunteers like you!

AMLATF Course
Description:
Let’s find out what anti-money laundering and anti-terrorist financing is all about and the risks of not complying with the regulations.  

In this course you will learn:


	The money laundering and terrorist financing issue.Canada's prevention and detection system.
	The impact of money laundering and terrorist financing.
	How money laundering and terrorist financing works.
	Your role in preventing and detecting money laundering and terrorist financing.
	Penalties for non-compliance of Canada's prevention and detection system.


All Coast Capital Savings employees are required to complete this course within 31 days of employment (except for exceptions authorized by the AMLATF Compliance Corporate Policy).

Title: AMLATF Assessment
Description:
All employees are required to pass this assessment with a minimum score of 80% within 30 days of employment.

Prerequisite: Complete the AMLATF Course

Description: Passing this 30 minute assessment with a minimum score of 80% will demonstrate your understanding of money laundering and terrorist financing and support the compliance requirements under the Proceeds of Crime (Money Laundering) & Terrorist Financing Act.

Not sure if you feel ready to take this assessment? You can go through the AMLATF Course as many times as you like before completing this assessment.

The 5 Question Leader
Description:
Managers and leaders find themselves stuck in three vicious circles. They’re frustrated by teams who have become overdependent on them. They’re overwhelmed by the amount of work they have to do. And they’re disconnected from their own Great Work – the work that has impact, the work that has meaning. Breaking out of those vicious circles is simpler than you might think. 

In this 90-minute session, you'll master five essential questions to help increase the focus, courage and resilience they need to have more impact in the work they do.

Examining Income Documents - Part 1
Description:
Welcome to Part 1 of this three part series. This series will help you to understand Coast Capital Savings requirements around income in order to determine the borrower’s ability to pay.

In this module you’ll learn how to determine what types of income documents are required. Allow 15 – 20 minutes to complete.

When you’re done, continue to Part 2, where you’ll learn how to analyze these documents in order to identify key pieces of information required to calculate Debt Service Ratios.

Finally, the last module in the series, Part 3 will help you put it all together by learning when certain types of income documents are needed.

In this module you’ll learn how to analyze income documents in order to identify key pieces of information required to calculate Debt Service Ratios. Allow 15 – 20 minutes to complete.

Title: Examining Income Documents - Part 3
Description:
Welcome to Part 3 of this three part series. This series will help you to understand Coast Capital Savings requirements around income in order to determine the borrower’s ability to pay.

This module will help you put it all together by learning when certain types of income documents are needed. Allow 30 minutes to complete.

A Conversation with Coast U
Description:
Coast U invites you to this one hour conversation about learning at Coast. We are seeking feedback from our employees to help us ensure that our learning programs and services remain effective and relevant.

During this session we’ll ask you for your input on what’s currently working / not working with Coast U’s programs, materials and other learning resources. You’ll also have a chance to share your suggestions for the future. We’ll wrap up with a preview of the things we’re working on 2018.

The Where You’re At Money Score™ Workshop
Description:
By invitation ONLY (Selected Relationship Managers MMB2’s & Managers, Member Service) as part of the Where You're At Money Score Training Program. 

This 2 day workshop will introduce the new Where You’re At Money Score™ and member experience.  By the end of this workshop, you will understand the important role you play in helping our members achieve financial well-being & what’s important in their life,  understand & have confidence in stepping a member through the digital Money Score, and  help to fulfil any recommendations that are presented.  There will also be opportunities in this workshop to discuss the importance of coaching , both from a member & employee perspective.
